This tour focused on 1 part of the Northern Pantanal. the major river ways of the Porto Jofre area. The entry and exit point for this trip is the city of Cuiaba.

Fitness Level:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from a boat which cruises the rivers of the Pantanal. So no special physical fitness is needed..

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 15 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Cuiaba - Arrival On arrival at Cuiaba airport, you will meet your local guide and driver and be taken to your hotel in Cuiaba. There is nothing planned for today, so the rest of the day is at your leisure. (no meals included today)

Transpantaniero - Travelling & Wildlife Watching After breakfast at the hotel you will leave at around 07:30am and depart for the Pantanal, this is a 1.5 hour drive to reach Transpantaneira Road, which is one of the best places in the world to spot wildlife (rivalling anywhere in Africa or India). Whilst travelling we will stop several times in order to appreciate the spectacular flora and fauna. We will be looking for hyacinth macaws, giant anteaters, capybara and other bird life but one species we will have no difficultly in finding is the Yacre caiman. There are around 20 million of these in the Pantanal and at this time of year they are everywhere. There are some excellent wildlife photography opportunities along the way and we may stop around half way to have lunch or if we are making good time head all of the way to Porto Jofre before having lunch. Then when we arrive at Porto Jofre we will check into the hotel and if there is still some time we may head out to look for wildlife (including Jaguars) nearby the hotel on the rivers. (breakfast and dinner included)

Transpantaniero - Travelling & Wildlife Watching This morning we can try one last time to find jaguars for a couple of hours in the early morning, but as we should have seen some by now you may choose to leave for the trip back to Cuiaba in the morning. So that the whole day is not as long as it could be. On the way back to Cuiaba we will once again have some wildlife watching along the Transpantaneiro Highway. Once we arrive back in Cuiaba you will check back into the same hotel as on your arrival. (breakfast is the only meal included today)
Home - Departure This morning you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included)

tourName: Jaguar spotting holiday in Brazil
placesVisited: Cuiaba, Paraguay River, the Pantanal, two jungle lodges, daily boat safaris, wildlife known to inhabit the area, includes: tapirs, monkeys, macaws, anacondas, capybaras, giant otters and jaguars

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Cuiabá, the capital of the Mato Grosso state and the gateway to the Pantanal wetlands. After arriving at the hotel, you have the rest of the day free to relax. Around 6pm, say oi to your tour leader and fellow travellers, when we gather as a group for the first time to get to know each other and learn more about the adventures ahead. Your tour leader then ensures a big welcome by arranging a group dinner. Want more time in Brazil? Secure pre-tour hotel nights through your sales representative. Accommodation: Deville Prime Cuiabá (or similar)

Head towards the remote Paraguay River in the Pantanal this morning. We start by driving 127mi (205km) towards the town of Cáceres before continuing a further 62mi (100km) on dirt roads to our lodge on the banks of the Paraguay River, where we spend the next four days exploring the region for jaguars and other wildlife. This off-the-beaten-path area is the ideal place for jaguar spotting and, with fewer visitors than other areas of the Pantanal, is also much quieter. This afternoon, we board our small motorboats to go on our first jaguar safari, exploring the river and its tributaries for the elusive big cat plus tapirs, monkeys, macaws, anacondas, capybaras, giant otters and any other wildlife we can find. While no guarantees can be made when it comes to wildlife, there is a 90 percent chance of seeing jaguars. Accommodation: Hotel Baiazinha (or similar)

We spend the next three days on morning and afternoon boat safaris looking for jaguars and other local wildlife and learning about the delicate ecosystem of the area. The exact lengths of the outings will vary depending on the sightings and you should be prepared to be flexible with the timetable. Make sure to bring all you’ll need including sun protection, insect protection, rain protection, water and your cameras and/or binoculars. Accommodation: Hotel Baiazinha (or similar)

This morning, retrace our steps towards Cáceres and onto Poconé and finally Araras Lodge. Surrounded by pristine forest, the lodge offers a range of activities designed to showcase the flora and fauna of the Pantanal, including jeep safaris, trail walks, nocturnal safaris, canoeing and horse riding. Naturalist guides from the lodge accompany us on all excursions to truly enhance our wildlife viewing. The programme changes per trip, dependant on the weather. This afternoon, head out on our first activity before returning and enjoying our first lodge dinner. Accommodation: Araras Lodge (or similar)

Enjoy a full programme of activities around the lodge. Typically, we have one activity in the morning and another in the afternoon. There are hundreds of bird species and dozens of mammals and reptiles to spot in the immediate surroundings; if we are lucky, we will catch sight of the striking hyacinth macaw (or arara jacinta in Portuguese) after which the lodge is named. The largest of the macaws, its dark blue plumage and the bright yellow skin around its eyes and beak make it instantly recognisable. Depending on the weather, it may be possible to take night-spotting tours after dinner to observe nocturnal animals. Accommodation: Araras Lodge (or similar)

If you're keen to make the most out of the jungle, it is possible to wake early and include a final pre-breakfast activity. After breakfast, head back to Cuiabá where the trip ends. We bid farewell and begin our return journey home. If you’d like a little more time to explore, speak to your sales representative about extending your stay.

tourName: Jaguar watching safari of the Pantanal, Brazil
placesVisited: Seven full days of fully guided wildlife watching in Pantanal Wetlands, Transpantaniera Highway, Stay in jaguar camp, Boat trips on Rio Cuiaba, Rio Tres Irmaos and Rio Piquiri rivers, Night safari, Superb Pantanal birdwatching
generalInfo:
This jaguar watching safari in the northern Pantanal wetlands of Brazil is one of the most exciting wildlife experiences you can hope for. This is by far the best region to see jaguar, the Pantanal being the world’s largest wetland area. As well as being home to jaguar, other magnificent wildlife includes caiman, giant otters, giant anteaters, tapir and pumas. As well as some of the most spectacular bird watching opportunities including the hyacinth macaw and toco toucan.

We are experts in finding jaguar as they rest or patrol the river banks and all of our jaguar watching is done from the safety of our shaded boats. To date, our average sightings is two per day on this trip with a mix of hunting, kills, swimming, mating as well as mothers and cubs. We are also proud of our 100% success rate of seeing jaguar.

Based around the fishing village of Porto Jofre, our tours are guided by a professional local guide who is expert not only in jaguar, but also in the region’s other prolific wildlife. This includes: capybara, collared peccary, yacre caiman, ocelot, puma, giant anteater, greater rhea, Brazilian tapir, giant otter and nine-banded armadillo. As a tailor made holiday we can organise this to suit your timing and interests, although we do recommend a minimum of three days to increase your chances of seeing jaguar.

Staying in jaguar camps, driving around the famous Transpantaneira Highway in your own vehicle, walking through forests and grasslands tracking the elusive big cat or trekking on horseback are all exciting options on this trip. We also offer the chance to do a spotlighting safari after dark to see some of the more elusive species like ocelot, puma, crab-eating fox, Brazilian tapir, crab-eating raccoons and many other nocturnal mammals. We bring thermal imaging and night vision equipment upon request.

As all the wildlife watching is all done from boat or vehicle in the northern Pantanal, any fitness level can participate. We also have tours that travel to the south of the Pantanal which involve 2-3 hour walks or some horse riding, so a greater level of mobility is required. Please note that we are also able to arrange this trip for solo travellers, upon request. Minimum age is 18 years old.

The price of this holiday includes:
All activities, all meals, bottled water, air con vehicle, drive, transfers, internal flights, guides, entrance fees, equipment, reference library.

Best time to see jaguar
We recommend early August to late October for seeing jaguar in the Pantanal, as this is the dry season when they, and other wildlife, gather at waterholes. September is particularly good.

dayInfo.description: Cuiaba – Arrival – On your arrival at the airport you will be met by your local driver/guide and transferred in a taxi to your hotel. (Lunch and or Dinner included (depending on the time of arrival)).

Transpantaniera – Travelling & Wildlife Watching – After breakfast you will begin the journey down the famous Transpantaniera highway towards Porto Jofre. This road is one of the best for wildlife watching in the entire world and it is possible to see over 100 species of birds and a dozen mammal species along the way. We recommend taking your time, we can go at whatever pace you wish but we prefer a slow one. We will have many photo opportunities and we should not have any difficulty in finding the numerous caiman, capybara and hundreds of herons, kingfishers, caracaras and wading birds. We will also keep our eyes open for giant anteaters, hyacinth macaws and capybara along the way. We will stop at one of the ranches for lunch before continuing and arriving at the jaguar camp in the late afternoon or early evening. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Transpantaniera – Travelling & Wildlife Watching – This morning you can either have a relaxing start to the day or have a morning river cruise for once last look for jaguars before packing up and heading back north up the Transpantaniera highway and towards Cuiaba. We can once again take this slowly and see what wildlife we can see along the way and then once you get back to Cuiaba you will have your last evening meal and night in Brazil. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)
Home – Departure – This morning after breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (Breakfast only)

tourName: Mammals of Brazil wildlife tour
generalInfo:
Brazil is a vast country with many different ecosystems and incredible biodiversity. This trip offers the chance to travel to three of the most diverse ecosystems, the Pantanal, Amazon Rainforest and the Cerrado savanna. All of this locations will be explored with expert guides in search of he best mammal life Brazil has to offer.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of wildlife watching holidays that focus on one specific rare or elusive species of mammals. These trips are specialised in that they have a distinct focus, a species which is the overall target for the tour. But of course we are exploring the wonderful and diverse natural environment and many other species can also be seen. However this is the only specialist mammal tour focusing on the Pantanal, Amazon and Cerrado available.

The Amazon rainforest or perhaps the vast wetland ecosystem of the Pantanal are what spring to mind first when people think of Brazil for wildlife watching. However there is one other large and mammal rich ecosystem in Brazil, in fact one that is unique to this huge country; the Cerrado. This is Brazil’s answer to the African savanna. A large grassland ecosystem in central Brazil. And this is the habitat of one of our highly targeted species the wonderful Maned Wolf.
There are some species which are found in two or even three of these locations, but each of our targeted ecosystems are home to some particularly targeted species. Firstly in the northern Pantanal we will focus on the mighty jaguar as well as the wonderful and vocal giant otter, in the southern Pantanal our focus shifts to the Brazilian tapir and giant anteater (among others), when in the southern Amazon we will look into the trees for a wealth of primate species as well as sloths and then in the grasslands of the cerrado we focus on maned wolves and armadillos.

All of this will be done with the expert guidance of local naturalist guides and where possible our own zoologist guides and wildlife researchers also. All you have to do is to get in touch with your budget and your group size and where you would like to go and we will come back to you with an itinerary and quote for your perfect specialist Brazilian mammal watching tour.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in Cuiaba. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned 4x4 vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers and safaris. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - a zoologist is not always available, so please inquire first if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip) who would escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through Brazil. Your naturalist escort is an expert in wildlife biology and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, guided walks, park entrance fees and permits. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the field. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide).

Seasons:

During September to October the weather in the Brazilian Pantanal and Cerrado ecosystems is hot and dry (although it is the end of the dry season and the occassional early rain can occur). The temperatures during the day and night are hot and they heat up quickly in the morning. At this time of year the rainy season is approaching and whilst rain is rare at this time of year it is not unheard of for a tropical storm to blow in.
The Amazonian rainforest weather is pretty standard all year around with hot, humid conditions punctuated by regular rainfall.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.• Our local naturalist guides have their ears to the ground and are constantly scouting new areas for rare and unusual wildlife. So we know of all of the locations to visit and we have the adaptability to change our plan (if needed) to take advantage of better wildlife watching in other locations whilst on the trip.
• We will stay in a variety of accommodation when on this tour, from quaint boutique style guest houses, larger hotel chains to hotels and lodges.
• Spend all the daylight hours searching for wildlife as well as spotlighting as many mammal species are nocturnal.
• All the above reasons give this, our specialist mammal watching tours give us a great success rate of seeing our targeted species (as well as many others). We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout Brazil so that we can try and find and observe mammals and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Brazil at other times of year and focusing on other groups of wildlife such as birds, reptiles & amphibians or even botany as well as other groups of animals or even specific species such as jaguars, maned wolves, giant armadillos etc. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour focused on 4 particular locations, firstly two ecosystems in the Pantanal, the northern and southern as well as the southern Amazonian and then the Cerrado and in particular, Emas National Park.

Fitness Level:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from a vehicle (4x4 or boat) and so the trip requires no special hiking experience or a specific level of physical fitness. This is a very easy trip to undertake. There are some optional activities from horse back if you wish and walking, however the walks are not particularly long and there are no steep inclines.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 15 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Cuiaba - Arrival On arrival at the airport in Cuiaba, you will be met by your guide and taken to the hotel. The rest of the day is at your leisure. (no meals included)

Transpantaniero - Travelling & Wildlife Watching After breakfast you will leave the hotel early and depart for the Pantanal. The majority of the route today is along the famous Transpantaneira Road. This road is is one of the best places in the world to spot wildlife, particularly birds. Along the way we will be looking for hyacinth macaws, giant anteaters, capybara and other bird life but one species we will have no difficultly in finding is the Yacre caiman. There are around 20 million of these in the Pantanal and at this time of year they are everywhere. On arrival at the end of the road we will check into our accommodation and be briefed on your first day on the rivers looking for jaguars tomorrow. (breakfast and dinner included)

Transpantaniero - Travelling & Wildlife Watching This morning you will have one more chance for jaguar spotting on the river, before coming back to the accommodation to pack and then leave and drive back up the Transpantaneiro to Cuiaba and your hotel for the night. (breakfast only included).

Southern Pantanal - Travelling Today you will leave the hotel and be taken to Cuiaba airport in time to catch a flight south to the other major city in the Pantanal; Campo Grande, (approx 1.5 hours). On arrival here your new driver will be waiting to take you to Barranco Alto lodge (5-6 hours). This is a lodge (called Fazendas here) where many species of animal are found. Along the way there are excellent chances to see wildlife such as greater rhea, giant anteaters, yellow armadillos and other wildlife. On arrival you will check in and then have an afternoon safari around the ranch to see some of its common wildlife. A short jeep safari or boat ride can often reveal Brazilian tapirs, giant anteaters, any of 3 species of deer, macaws and possibly a big cat. (breakfast and dinner included).

Cuiaba - Travelling This morning we will have a more relaxed start, before we catch our private chartered flight to Campo Grande. This flight is a brilliant way of seeing the Pantanal so have your camera ready for this great scenic flight. You will then connect to the commercial flight back to Cuiaba and then be taken to your hotel for the night. (breakfast is the only meal included).

Cristalino Lodge - Travelling This morning you will catch your internal flight north to the southern Amazon Rainforest and in particular the reserve of Cristalino. On arrival at Alta Floresta you will meet a new driver and be driven for around 1.5 hours before getting a boat (1 hour) to the lodge. After checking in you will have the rest of the day at your leisure as you begin to familiarise yourself with the lodge and its surroundings. (breakfast and dinner included).

Cuiaba - Travelling This morning you will depart the Amazon and head to Alta Floresta to catch your return flight back to Cuiaba. On arrival in Cuiaba you will be taken to your hotel for the night. (breakfast only included).

Chapodao do Ceu - Travelling After breakfast you will be transferred from Cuiaba to Chapodao do Ceu which is the gateway town to Emas National Park. Which is the best example of cerrado left in Brazil for wildlife watching. The drive is a long one, approximately 8 hours. It will be late when we arrive and the rest of the day will be at leisure. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

Cuiaba - Travelling Today you will be transferred back to Cuiaba for the final time. The drive will be a long one again and on arrival the hotel you will check in and the rest of the day will be at your leisure. (breakfast only included).
Departure Today you will be collected from the hotel in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

tourName: Maned wolf watching holiday in Brazil
generalInfo:
Travel to the most reliable places in the world to see the stunning and unique Maned Wolf. The fox on stilts lives in the Brazilian grasslands and this tour focuses on this species.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of wildlife watching holidays that focus on one specific rare or elusive species. These trips are specialised in that they have a distinct focus, a species which is the overall target for the tour. But of course we are exploring the wonderful and diverse natural environment and many other species can also be seen. However this is the only specialist tour for Maned Wolves in the world, and this safari offers the greatest chances of seeing this species in the wild.

The Amazon rainforest or perhaps the vast wetland ecosystem of the Pantanal are what spring to mind first when people think of Brazil for wildlife watching. However there are many other ecosystems and some of them are unique to Brazil. One such ecosystem is the Cerrado. This is Brazil’s answer to the African savanna. A large grassland ecosystem in central Brazil. And this is the habitat of our target species the wonderful Maned Wolf.
Resembling a fox on stilts it is one of the strangest looking animals in the world and this trip travels to the best places in the world to see them. There is of course a chance of seeing many other species in the Cerrado, and as well as visiting the Cerrado we will also visit a remote monastery where the monks have been leaving fruit out for the local “street dogs” for decades. It was only when one monk saw that they were in fact Maned Wolves that this place become famous. And today it I possible to visit to see this incredible animal very close.

Guided by expert naturalist guides and visiting stunning locations full of wildlife, we will explore the Cerrado and aim to showcase the unusual Maned Wolf and many other species. All you have to do is to get in touch with your budget and your group size and where you would like to go and we will come back to you with an itinerary and quote for your perfect specialist Maned Wolf watching tour.

We also include all vehicle safaris, guided walks, park entrance fees and permits. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the Cerrado. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

During September to October the weather in the Brazilian Cerrado grasslands is hot and dry with plenty of blue skies during the day. The temperatures during the day and night are hot and they heat up quickly in the morning. At this time of year the rainy season is approaching and whilst rain is rare at this time of year it is not unheard of for a tropical storm to blow in.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.

So we know of all of the locations to visit and we have the adaptability to change our plan (if needed) to take advantage of better wildlife watching in other locations whilst on the trip.
• We will stay in a variety of accommodation when on this tour, from quaint boutique style guest houses, larger hotel chains to hotels and lodges.

We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Brazil at other times of year and focusing on other species such as jaguars, giant otters, giant anteaters, tapirs, rainforest primates and many other species. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.

dayInfo.description: Cuiaba - On arrival at Cuiaba airport, you will meet your guide and be driven to your hotel for the night. The drive to Emas is a long one and so we will not attempt this today and it can be a long journey to get to the city of Cuiaba. So after checking in you will have the rest of the day to rest before leaving tomorrow for Emas. (no meals included today).

Chapodao do Creu – This morning after breakfast you will depart from Cuiaba and begin the drive to Chapodao do Ceu. This is the gateway town to Emas National Park which in turn is home to a large (possibly the largest in the world) population of maned wolves. This drive is long and can take around 8 hours. There is no other way of accessing this remote park as there are no airports nearby. On arrival you will be free to rest before entering the park for the first time tomorrow. (breakfast and dinner are included today).

Cuiaba - Today you will be transferred all the way back to Cuiaba. After the long drive you will have the evening to rest and relax before catching your flight to your next destination tomorrow. (breakfast only included today).

Belo Horizonte – This morning we will leave Cuiaba and fly eastwards to the city of Belo Horzonte. This large city will play host to us as we stay the night here before continuing to a little known area of Brazil tomorrow. (breakfast, lunch and dinner).

Caraca Park – Today we will depart from Belo Horizonte and drive to Caraca Park. On our arrival we will check in and then have the rest of the day at leisure. The real treat for people staying here occurs at dusk when then a small population of local maned wolves visit the grounds to feed on the fruit and dog food left for them by the monks. This special relationship started many years ago when the monks left some of their leftover food out for the stray dogs of the town. However it was not the stray dogs that showed up but instead the rarely seen maned wolves. They have since been regular visitors. (breakfast and dinner only today).

Belo Horizonte - This morning we will leave the hotel after breakfast and be transferred back to the city of Belo Horizonte and after checking into the hotel the rest of the day is free for you to rest and relax before your long flight home tomorrow.
Home - Today you will be taken to the airport in time to catch your return flight home.

tourName: Pantanal and Iguazu tour, Brazil
generalInfo: Venture into Brazil's heart, from the vast Pantanal Wetlands to the thundering Iguaçu Falls. Witness vibrant wildlife on thrilling safaris, stroll through lush rainforests and marvel at the world’s most awe-inspiring cascades. Experience Brazil and Argentina's shared natural wonder, and explore the captivating beauty of the Iguazu Falls from both sides. A fusion of adventure and tranquility await.

dayInfo.description: Campo Grande - Pantanal, Brazil: Gateway to Wild Adventures Departure from Campo Grande Our day begins as we depart Campo Grande, journeying through captivating landscapes towards Buraco das Piranhas, traveling roughly 300 km, approximately a 4-hour scenic drive. Transfer to Pantanal Lodge Arriving at Buraco das Piranhas, a specialized vehicle awaits, ready to transport us deep into the Pantanal Wetlands region. After a 40-minute drive, soak up the extraordinary views of lush greenery, picturesque waterways, and wildlife sightings along the way. Arrival and Relaxing at Lodge Settle comfortably into your accommodation nestled in the heart of the awe-inspiring Pantanal, the largest and most diverse floodplain on earth. Enjoy the tranquil atmosphere of the lodge as you unpack and unwind amidst nature’s beauty. Welcome Dinner Savor a delightful Pantanal-inspired dinner at the lodge, sampling delicious regional dishes rich in flavor. Unwind and mingle with fellow travelers as you prepare for the exciting explorations ahead.

Pantanal, Brazil: Foot and Jeep Wildlife Exploration Early Morning Ecological Walk Begin your day with a guided ecological walk through pristine forests and open grasslands. Together with our knowledgeable local bilingual guide, discover fascinating flora and fauna like monkeys swinging overhead, vibrant birdlife, possible sightings of capybaras, marsh deer, and intriguing reptiles. Lunch and Leisure Time Return to the lodge around noon for lunch, sampling delightful dishes featuring local ingredients. Afterwards, enjoy serene downtime, relax in hammocks or simply take in peaceful views of the Pantanal wilderness. Afternoon 4x4 Safari We set out in rugged 4x4 vehicles for an unforgettable safari across Pantanal da Nhecolândia— famous for its rich diversity and abundant wildlife. Spotting opportunities include jacare caymans, jabiru storks, giant anteaters, and if fortunate— the elusive jaguar. Dinner and Nighttime Silence Close the day with an authentic meal served at the lodge, then rest under starry Pantanal skies thinking about tomorrow’s adventures.

Pantanal -Brazil: Pantanal River Adventures & Night Safari Morning River Safari & Piranha Fishing After breakfast, we embark on a captivating boat safari through winding rivers of the flooded plains. Enjoy an exciting fishing experience, challenging your skills against the fierce and infamous piranha. Our expert guides will demonstrate fishing techniques while sharing intriguing facts about this famous predator. Lunch Break and Rest Take a quiet pause with lunch at the lodge, tasting local cuisine and re-energizing yourself amid soothing surroundings. Afternoon Leisurely River Float Late afternoon, surrender to total relaxation as we gently drift downstream by boat through flooded river channels. This leisurely journey allows close wildlife observation and breathtaking photography opportunitieswatch for otters, capybaras, and diverse bird species drawn to the water’s edge. Exciting Nocturnal Wildlife Observation After sunset, venture onto the water again for our nocturnal safari. With a spotlight in hand, guides will help spot elusive nighttime wildlife—such as caiman eyes glowing in the dark, foxes exploring riverbanks, and rare night birds in their element. A truly magical experience! Dinner under Pantanal Stars End this unforgettable day recounting highlights around dinner beneath a sky filled with endless stars.

Pantanal - Bonito, Brazil: Scenic Transfer to Beautiful Bonito Morning Farewell & Breakfast Enjoy your last breakfast at the Pantanal lodge, savoring delicious regional dishes, fresh fruits and beverages before preparing to say goodbye to the breathtaking natural scenery. Private Drive to Bonito Relax aboard your private transportation, departing from Pantanal do Corumbá towards Bonito. As you drive, unwind, appreciate the picturesque landscapes, vibrant rural countryside and lush greenery that typify the Mato Grosso do Sul region. This pleasant and comfortable transfer allows you plenty of opportunities to reflect on your Pantanal adventure and anticipate your upcoming experiences in captivating Bonito. Arrival in Bonito Upon arrival in Bonito, you'll find yourself enchanted by one of Brazil’s premier eco-tourism regions. Famous for crystal-clear river waters, stunning caves and abundant aquatic life, Bonito offers new and exciting adventures ahead.

Bonito - Free Day: Leisure and Exploration in Bonito Relaxing Start and Leisurely Breakfast Wake up at your leisure and enjoy a peaceful morning in beautiful Bonito. Take your breakfast slowly, savor tropical fruits, fresh juices, and local delicacies, preparing yourself for a relaxed or adventure-filled free day ahead. Optional Adventures and Tours With this free day, Bonito's remarkable nature invites you to choose your ideal experience. You can arrange these optional activities locally: Crystal Clear Snorkeling Adventure Drift through incredible freshwater rivers (such as Rio da Prata or Rio Sucuri) showcasing Bonito’s famously transparent waters and dazzling fish species. Waterfall and Trail Hike Set out on lush green trails leading to spectacular waterfalls. Enjoy rejuvenating swims underneath cascading waters and immerse yourself deeply in pristine surroundings. Cave Exploration Discover remarkable caves like Gruta do Lago Azul (Blue Lake Cave), famed for its awe-inspiring turquoise waters and fascinating geological formations dating back thousands of years. Adventure Activities If seeking excitement, try abseiling, treetop canopy, zip-lining or eco-cycling to see Bonito from thrilling new angles. Relax and Unwind in Town Enjoy strolling through Bonito’s charming town streets, stopping for refreshing drinks, local snacks or souvenirs in local boutiques. Relax at quaint cafés or simply unwind by your accommodation's pool, soaking in the peaceful atmosphere around you. Dinner and Evening at Leisure End your leisurely day at one of Bonito's inviting local restaurants, savoring delicious regional dishes showcasing fresh local ingredients. Chat with friendly locals and fellow travelers as you recount the day's memories under Bonito’s star-filled, peaceful skies.

Bonito - Campo Grande: Journey from Bonito to Iguacu Falls Morning Farewell in Bonito Begin your morning with a leisurely, delicious breakfast, savoring Bonito’s inviting charm one last time. Take in a final stroll or snapshot before you leave this tranquil town behind. Countryside Transfer to Campo Grande Settle into a shared transfer vehicle and enjoy a picturesque drive through rolling farmlands and lush ranches, reflecting on your Bonito adventures as you make your way towards Campo Grande. Campo Grande: Arrival and Departure Upon arrival in Campo Grande, take a short break to stretch your legs or grab a snack. At 14:30, board your comfortable long-distance bus bound for Foz do Iguacu. The journey promises sweeping glimpses of Brazil’s heartland as you settle in for an overnight ride—approximately 15 hours and 40 minutes on the road. Overnight Bus Journey to Iguacu Relax as you’re whisked across the Brazilian countryside, watching rural villages and open fields drift past your window under the starlit sky. Rest up for tomorrow’s adventure!

Foz do Iguacu, Brazil: Majestic Iguazu Falls & Exotic Bird Encounter Early arrival in Foz de Iguazu Check in to your hotel room and enjoy the morning until your next scheduled acticitiy. Explore Parque das Aves - Bird Park Step into a lush, vibrant 16.5-hectare sanctuary nestled within the exuberant Atlantic Forest—Parque das Aves. Wander scenic walkways through lush native habitats that house over 1,320 diverse birds representing 143 extraordinary species gathered from all around Brazil and the globe. This is far more than an ordinary nature walk: you'll venture into interactive aviaries, coming face-to-face with iconic birds like brilliant macaws, rare parrots, and friendly toucans. Feel the stirring sensation as colorful wings flutter gracefully around you, and enjoy fascinating insights shared by your knowledgeable local guide. A truly unique and enchanting wildlife experience. Brazilian Side of Iguazu Falls Enter Iguazu National Park, a protected paradise of rich Atlantic rainforest ecosystems established in 1939. Stroll along a 1,200-meter-long panoramic walkway that brilliantly showcases the majesty and immensity of Iguazu Falls. Enjoy multiple viewpoints revealing breathtaking panoramas of the impressive cascades—275 waterfalls in total—including the four most renowned: Floriano, Deodoro da Fonseca, Benjamin Constant, and the iconic and awe-inspiring Salto União, famously called the Devil's Throat. Listen closely to the powerful roar, feel the mist on your face, and capture stunning photographs that will become lasting memories of this natural wonder. Panoramic Elevator & Return Conclude your unforgettable tour with a thrilling ride on the panoramic elevator, offering sweeping final views of the falls from above. Return comfortably to your vehicle, reflecting on an exhilarating day immersed in both nature’s serenity and power. Evening at Leisure Spend a relaxing evening exploring local cuisine at nearby eateries or resting at your hotel, savoring today's remarkable adventures and looking forward to the journeys still ahead.

Foz do Iguacu, Brazil: Argentina's Spectacular Iguazu Experience Morning Breakfast Kickstart this thrilling day with a delicious breakfast, featuring freshly brewed coffee, tropical fruit selections, pastries, and local specialties at your accommodation. Journey into Argentina – Iguazu National Park Set off on a crossing into Argentina’s side, toward the renowned Iguazu National Park, an iconic UNESCO World Heritage site famed for its dramatic beauty and impressive biodiversity. Your guide will facilitate border procedures for a smooth and seamless transition into this natural wonderland. Upper Circuit Walk – Panoramic Views Explore the Upper Circuit trail, offering sweeping views of Iguazu’s entire waterfalls complex and serene delta islands. From raised walkways, marvel at the magnificent vistas from above—witness powerful cascades plunging dramatically down cliffs surrounded by lush green jungle. The totally immersive scenery provides perfect panoramic photo opportunities, allowing you to appreciate the extraordinary scale and splendor of this nature’s masterpiece. Lunch Break in Nature Take time to rest and refresh in the park’s relaxing setting; grab lunch at one of the designated eateries within the scenic surroundings, savoring regional Argentine flavors as you reenergize amidst the lush greenery. Lower Circuit Walk – Close Encounter Experience Follow pathways on the Lower Circuit—offering intimate encounters and exhilarating proximity to several magnificent waterfalls. Experience close-up views and delight in the misty embrace, capturing fascinating views of the powerful water flows crashing into the river below. This route is sure to awaken your senses, immersing you in Iguazu’s spectacular beauty and refreshing spray. Devil’s Throat Viewing Platform Finally, approach the breathtaking highlight—the iconic Devil’s Throat (Garganta del Diablo). Follow sturdy walkways extending dramatically above rushing waters, eventually reaching a platform perched right on the edge of these stunning horseshoe-shaped waterfalls. Feel the immense power of the torrents tumbling down, hear their thundering roar, and photograph this incredible phenomenon up close, leaving a powerful, lasting memory of nature's majesty. Return to Foz do Iguacu, Brazil After an extraordinary day on Argentina’s side, comfortably travel back to your accommodation in Foz do Iguacu. Relax during the short journey, reflecting on adventures experienced at one of the world’s greatest natural wonders. Evening Leisure Spend the evening relaxing at your hotel or dining at local eateries, cherishing unforgettable memories gathered during the day's thrilling exploration.

Foz do Iguacu, Brazil: Farewell to Iguacu - Safe Travels! Leisurely Breakfast & Farewell Relax and savor your final breakfast in Iguacu. Indulge in local Brazilian treats, fresh fruits, pastries, and aromatic coffee as you reminisce on the unforgettable experiences you’ve enjoyed throughout your journey. Transfer to Foz do Iguacu Airport (Timing as needed) At an agreed-upon time after breakfast, your driver will meet you at your accommodation lobby, assisting with your luggage for a stress-free transfer. Sit back and enjoy a smooth ride to Foz do Iguacu Airport, soaking in your last glimpses of this spectacular region. Departure & Onward Journey Bid farewell to your local hosts with a heart full of lasting memories and incredible stories to share from your Brazilian adventure. We wish you a pleasant and safe onward flight and look forward to welcoming you again soon. Safe travels ahead!

tourName: Pantanal rare wildlife holiday in Brazil
generalInfo:
This tour takes you to both the northern and southern Pantanal in search of a huge wealth of wildlife. From the jaguar capital of the world in the northern Pantanal to several wonderful and unique lodges in the southern Pantanal.

Explore these locations in a variety of different ways; walking, jeep safaris, river safaris and horseback safaris. All of these ways to see the environment and wildlife are designed to highlight different areas and species. We have a fantastic success rate in seeing all of the larger mammal species, including jaguars, maned wolves, tapirs, giant anteaters and giant otters. For anyone wishing to see the wonders of the Pantanal this is the tour for you.

This specific tour offers the chance to try and see some of the rarer species of the Pantanal including giant armadillos, ocelots and maned wolves.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of wildlife watching holidays that focus on one specific rare or elusive species of mammals. These trips are specialised in that they have a distinct focus, a species which is the overall target for the tour. But of course we are exploring the wonderful and diverse natural environment and many other species can also be seen. However this is the only specialist mammal tour focusing on both the northern and southern the Pantanal.

On this tour you will firstly visit the northern Pantanal and our focus will be on some of the rarer species here from jaguars and ocelots to giant otters and giant armadillos.

All of this will be done with the expert guidance of local naturalist guides and where possible our own zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) guides and wildlife researchers also. All you have to do is to get in touch with your budget and your group size and where you would like to go and we will come back to you with an itinerary and quote for your perfect specialist Pantanal wildlife watching tour.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in Cuiaba and Campo Grande. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned 4x4 vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers and safaris. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through Brazil. Your naturalist escort is an expert in wildlife biology and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, guided walks, park entrance fees and permits. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the field. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

During September to October the weather in the Brazilian Pantanal is hot and dry (although it is the end of the dry season and the occassional early rain can occur). The temperatures during the day and night are hot and they heat up quickly in the morning. At this time of year the rainy season is approaching and whilst rain is rare at this time of year it is not unheard of for a tropical storm to blow in.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• Our local naturalist guides have their ears to the ground and are constantly scouting new areas for rare and unusual wildlife. So we know of all of the locations to visit and we have the adaptability to change our plan (if needed) to take advantage of better wildlife watching in other locations whilst on the trip.
• We will stay in a variety of accommodation when on this tour, from quaint boutique style guest houses, larger hotel chains to hotels and lodges.
• Spend all the daylight hours searching for wildlife as well as spotlighting as many mammal species are nocturnal.
• All the above reasons give this, our specialist mammal watching tours give us a great success rate of seeing our targeted species (as well as many others). We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout Brazil so that we can try and find and observe mammals and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Brazil at other times of year and focusing on other groups of wildlife such as birds, reptiles & amphibians or even botany as well as other groups of animals or even specific species such as jaguars, maned wolves, giant armadillos etc. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour focused on 2 areas of the vast Pantanal wetland ecosystem; the northern which is serviced by the city of Cuiaba and the southern which is served by the city of Campo Grande.

Fitness Level:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from a vehicle (4x4 or boat) and so the trip requires no special hiking experience or a specific level of physical fitness. This is a very easy trip to undertake. There are some optional activities from horse back if you wish and walking, however the walks are not particularly long and there are no steep inclines.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 15 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Cuiaba - Arrival When you arrive into Cuiaba airport, you will meet your local guide and driver and then be taken to your hotel for the night. The rest of the day will be at leisure. (no meals included today).

Transpantaniero - Travelling & Wildlife Watching After breakfast at the hotel you will depart for the Pantanal. After around 1.5 hours of driving you will reach the Transpantaneira Road. This is one of the best places in the world to spot wildlife. We will be looking for hyacinth macaws, giant anteaters, capybara and other bird life but one species we will have no difficultly in finding is the Yacre caiman. There are some excellent wildlife photography opportunities along the way. Once you arrive you will have some food at the Porto Jofre hotel and then if there is time head out on your first trip to look for jaguars on the rivers. (breakfast and dinner only included).

Transpantanerio / Campo Grande - Travelling This morning will start very early as we have a very long day ahead of us. We will depart from the camp at in the morning and head back to the city. We will fly from Cuiaba to Campo Grande and when we will arrive in Campo Grande and then be met at the airport by our driver and be taken to our city hotel for the night. Dinner can be served at the hotel or a nearby restaurant. (breakfast only included)

Campo Grande - Travelling This morning we will depart from Baia das Pedras after breakfast and take private Cessna planes out over the Pantanal towards the city of Campo Grande. The views as we fly over the mosaic of cattle ranch, forest, grassland, lakes and rivers is wonderful from the air and it is also possible to spot wildlife with giant anteaters, tapirs and rhea all very obvious from the air. On arrival in Campo Grande airport you will be taken to the larger airport to catch your return flight home or to your hotel in the town for tonight. (breakfast only included)
Home - Departure After breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast only included)

tourName: Pantanal self drive holiday, Brazil
generalInfo:
Experience a road trip through the breathtaking Pantanal Wetlands in Brazil, revealing its lush landscapes and rich biodiversity. The adventure unfolds with a scenic 4 to 5-hour drive to Bonito, an idyllic haven celebrated for its serene escape from urban chaos, immersing travellers into the heart of nature. Delve into the tranquil emerald waters of the Rio da Prata, where a vibrant colourful snorkelling adventure awaits.

Continue the expedition deeper into the Pantanal, establishing your base at the Refúgio da Ilha Eco-Lodge. This haven is renowned for its myriad activities and wildlife encounters, offering a diverse range of excursions. The lodge presents a flexible itinerary featuring inclusive excursions, thrilling adventures, and educational journeys, all led by seasoned in-house guides. At Refúgio da Ilha, tailor your days to your liking—whether actively exploring the delicate ecosystem on horseback or by canoe or unwinding amidst its tranquil surroundings. This immersive experience ensures a fun blend of discovery and relaxation.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVE CAMPO GRANDE - On arrival at Campo Grande airport, pick up your rental car at the Localiza counter and head to Deville Campo Grande. Situated in the city centre, this hotel combines luxury and convenience, serving as an ideal base to start our road trip adventure. Depending on your arrival time, you may opt to proceed directly to Bonito from Campo Grande airport. Journey time: approx. 30 minutes (15km)

ROAD TRIP - Depart on a 4 to 5-hour journey from Campo Grande to the picturesque village of Bonito, traversing well-maintained roads that showcase the lush landscapes of Mato Grosso do Sul. Brazil's eco-tourism capital, Bonito, is located against a backdrop of limestone plateaux and valleys, providing a haven for outdoor enthusiasts. Crystal-clear streams and deep lagoons teem with vibrant fish, surrounded by lush green vegetation along the riverbank. Beyond its breathtaking scenery, Bonito offers diverse experiences for visitors. Stay overnight at the charming Pousada Olha d’Agua, just a short distance from the heart of Bonito. Journey time: approx. 4-5h (310km)

SNORKELLING IN THE RIO PRATA - Enjoy an extraordinary day in Bonito exploring the captivating Rio da Prata and its enchanting surroundings. Immerse yourself in the abundance of wildlife, meander through crystal clear lagoons, and revel in the lush vegetation lining the riverbanks. Plunge into the crystalline waters of Olho d’Água, a serene tributary of the Rio de la Prata, for an unparalleled snorkelling experience, unmatched in Brazil. The river acts as a living aquarium, showcasing a vibrant array of multi-coloured fish species and underwater plants, creating a mesmerising visual spectacle. After a delcious lunch on the shores of a nearby lagoon, proceed to the ancient sinkhole, Buraco das Araras. Plummeting 124 metres, this remarkable spectacle serves as a sanctuary for macaws and tropical birds, finding refuge in the safety of giant cave walls. The lake formed at the sinkhole's bottom is home to caimans and other aquatic animals. As the sun sets, witness a flurry of activity with hundreds of squawking birds returning to their nests, creating a memorable conclusion to the day. Journey time from Bonito to Rio da Prata: approx. 1 h (50 km) Journey time from Rio da Prata to Buraco das Araras: approx. 15 min. (10 km) Journey time from Buraco das Araras to Bonito: approx. 1 h (55 km)

EXPLORING THE PANTANAL - The morning journey north towards the Pantanal is a 3-hour drive through forests, picturesque meadows, and over the Rio Miranda on well-paved roads. A notable detour leads to the Boca da Onça Private Reserve, where hiking trails wind through emerald forests, unveiling 14 waterfalls, the tallest plunging an impressive 156 metres. Upon reaching the Rio Salobra's banks, discover Pantanal tranquility at Refúgio da Ilha. This intimate eco-tourism lodge, a family-run farmhouse, welcomes early arrivals with a delicious local lunch. Fuelled and ready, engage in the lodge’s afternoon activity, offering a glimpse into the incredible biodiversity in the surroundings. As the day winds down, savour a delightful dinner, unwind in the homely atmosphere, and share stories with fellow travellers and the welcoming host family. Journey time: approx. 3h (160 km)

EXPLORING THE PANTANAL - During your stay at Refúgio da Ilha, their expert guides offer two daily excursions, allowing you to delve into the wonders of the Pantanal. Explore this unique and long-unexplored ecosystem through various tours and educational trips. The Pantanal, previously inaccessible, now stands as a pristine example of natural preservation. Spanning 150,000 km², it hosts over 700 bird species, 80 mammals, 50 reptiles, 300 fish types, and numerous plant varieties—a paradise for wildlife enthusiasts. Your adventures at Refúgio da Ilha include boat trips along Rio Salobra and Miranda, horse-back rides, walking trails, birding, 4 x 4 off-road adventures, and canoeing, each promising a unique perspective of the thriving Pantanal ecosystem.

EXPLORING THE PANTANAL - Today ensures another full day of wildlife discoveries in this eco-sanctuary. Those choosing to navigate the waterways may encounter colonies of giant otters that inhabit this place. Alternatively, embark on a leisurely horseback ride to uncover the diverse flora and fauna of areas possibly challenging to explore on foot. Whether on water or horseback, the Pantanal's natural wonders await your exploration, promising a day filled with enchanting wildlife encounters in this unique habitat.

RETURN TO CAMPO GRANDE - As your Pantanal adventure concludes, commence the final drive back to Campo Grande. The return journey unveils a fresh perspective, offering stunning wetland views. Expect a 4-hour drive, plus additional time to return the rental car before any onward flight. Reflect on the captivating Pantanal experiences, cherishing the memories while traversing the scenic landscapes one last time.

dayInfo.description: Cuiaba - Arrival When you arrive into Cuiaba airport, you will meet your local guide and driver and then be taken to your hotel for the night. The rest of the day will be at leisure. (no meals included today).

Transpantaniero - Travelling & Wildlife Watching After breakfast at the hotel you will depart for the Pantanal. After around 1.5 hours of driving you will reach the Transpantaneira Road. This is one of the best places in the world to spot wildlife. We will be looking for hyacinth macaws, giant anteaters, capybara and other bird life but one species we will have no difficultly in finding is the Yacre caiman. There are some excellent wildlife photography opportunities along the way. Once you arrive you will have some food at the Porto Jofre hotel and then if there is time head out on your first trip to look for jaguars on the rivers. (breakfast and dinner only included).

Transpantaniero - Travelling & Wildlife Watching This morning you will have one more morning of wildlife watching to try and find one last jaguar before having breakfast and then departing for the trip back to Cuiaba in the morning. Once you get back to the city you will be taken to the hotel and the rest of the day will be at your leisure. (breakfast is the only meal included).

Fazenda Barranco Alto - Travelling & Wildlife Watching This morning after breakfast you will travel to Cuiaba airport to catch the short internal flight south to Campo Grande (1.5 hrs). On arrival here you will meet your new local guide and from here you will be transferred in a 4×4 vehicle to Barranco Alto lodge (5-6 hours). The length of this journey is dependent on the amount of wildlife we see on the way. There are excellent chances to see greater rhea, giant anteaters and other grassland species. We should arrive in the early afternoon and so you will be able to have an afternoon safari around the ranch to see some of its common wildlife. A short jeep safari or boat ride can often reveal Brazilian tapirs, giant anteaters, any of 3 species of deer, macaws and possibly a big cat. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Cuiaba - Travelling This morning we will have a more relaxed morning before catching your private plane transfer from here to Campo Grande. This flight is a brilliant way of seeing the Pantanal so have your camera ready for this great scenic flight. Once we arrive at the air taxi airport we will be transferred to the domestic airport in time to get the connecting flight back to Cuiaba. The rest of the evening is at your leisure. (breakfast is the only meal included).
Home Today you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included).

tourName: Rio Carnival 2026 tour, Brazil
generalInfo: Experience the vibrant energy of Rio de Janeiro's world-famous Carnival with an unforgettable guided tour. Immerse yourself in iconic parades, dazzling samba shows, and authentic street parties. Uncover hidden gems with expert local guides, enjoy stunning city views from Sugarloaf Mountain, and relax on the beautiful Copacabana beach. Perfect for culture enthusiasts, this adventure promises an exhilarating blend of music, dance, and breathtaking sights in one of Brazil’s most captivating cities. Join the ultimate Carnival celebration now!

dayInfo.description: Rio de Janeiro, Brazil: Departure Time: 15:00 Thursday (27 February): Rio Arrival & Lively Lapa Start Welcome to Rio! Arrive at the airport and head to your Lapa accommodation – the heart of Carnival's excitement. Lapa is bursting with samba clubs, theaters, capoeira, and more. Feel free to arrive at your convenience, with check-in from 3 PM. Around 6 PM, meet the group to review the event schedule. Let the festivities begin! Enjoy your first caipirinha, learn samba moves in a group class, and get face painting. Then embrace Lapa's vibrant nightlife, guided by your Tour Leader, for an authentic street party experience. Pre-Tour Night: Consider an extra night for recovery and exploring Rio before Carnival. Shopping Tip: Bring "fancy-dress" items for Carnival's street parties. You might find items locally, but best to come prepared. Note: Itinerary may change due to unexpected circumstances beyond our control.

Rio de Janeiro, Brazil: Friday (28 February): Rio City Tour, Make-up Artist, Sambadrome Parade (B) During today's breakfast, your Tour Leader will be available to go through today's plans and answer any questions you may have. After breakfast, the Full Experience group will be taken on an all-inclusive tour of Rio de Janeiro. You will drive through the Tijuca National Park to Corvocado. After visiting the statue of Christ the Redeemer, you’ll be taken to the gorgeous suburb of Santa Teresa to be amazed by some very impressive old mansions, art galleries and the famous Santa Teresa trams. Next stop will be the tiled Steps of Selaron in Lapa - made world famous by the 2003 song ‘Beautiful’ featuring Snoop Dogg. The final stop on the tour will be Sugarloaf Mountain, which is ascended via cable car. You will have the chance to see Guanabara Bay, the Rio-Niteroi Bridge and Christ the Redeemer statue in all it's beauty. A second cable car will then take you to the top of Sugarloaf Mountain (295m), where the views are simply breathtaking! After the city tour, you will be dropped back to your accommodation, where there will be time to prepare for the main Carnival event: Sambadrome Parade at Sambodromo! All of the city's best samba schools parade their outrageous floats and costumes down the runway here, and you will be able to view it all from the stands above. There are no fixed seats, but our section will be full of fun, rowdy revelers! In preparation for this incredible event, you will have the opportunity to get your face painted by our professional make-up artist again, and have your picture taken by our photographer.

Rio de Janeiro, Brazil: Saturday (1 March): Bloco Street Party OR Ipanema Beach, Lunch, Boat Party Cruise (B, L) This morning, after breakfast, you will have the opportunity to be taken to one of the best blocos (street parties) in town. Each day your tour leader will tell you about and offer to take you to one of these incredible blocos, all in different locations around Rio. There will also be time to visit some of them on your own if you wish. OR if you would like a morning on the beach there will be another tour leader on hand ready to accompany you to Ipanema beach for a swim and a sun bathe. Of course the other third option is to have a rest and do nothing this morning! The choice is yours ;-) Later in the day the group will meet up at the hotel and stroll down together to the Marina da Gloria - enjoying a nice included lunch on the way. You will then all hop aboard a magnificent schooner boat that will cruise around Rio's spectacular Guanabara Bay for around 3-4 hours. Enjoy an open bar during the first hour of the cruise and make the most of the dance floor, music and chill-out area. Returning just after sunset, you'll have the chance to view the city, Sugarloaf Mountain, and Christ the Redeemer from a stunningly different light and angle. After some relaxing time back in your accommodation, prepare yourself for another exciting night. You'll be shown the best nightlife the city has to offer!

Rio de Janeiro, Brazil: Sunday (2 March): Bloco Street Party, Copacabana Beach Trip, Sunset drink (B) Once again, you will start your day with a nice breakfast and the chance to meet up with your Tour Leader to check the itinerary for the day and ask any questions you may have. This morning, you'll be taken once again to the very best carnival bloco street-party in town. Feel free to wear your swimsuits underneath your clothes, and don't forget sunscreen. We make the most of this day, going to Copacabana Beach straight from the bloco. Time to relax and chill here. At the end of this perfect day we sip on a drink (out of a coconut if you wish!) and watch the sunset over the Dois Irmãos mountains from Arpoador Rock with beautiful views in all directions from Copacabana to Ipanema and Leblon. You'll then be accompanied back to the accommodation where you can either collapse into bed or get ready for another fun night on the town. Tonight, your Tour Leader will once again offer to take you to the very best Carnival parties that Rio has to offer!

Rio de Janeiro, Brazil: Monday (3 March): Bloco Street Party, Afternoon Favela Tour, Farewell Churrasco Dinner (B, D) If you’re up for another morning bloco street party, our Tour Leaders will be ready to accompany you to one of the best and last blocos of Rio Carnival! Or perhaps you’re ready for a bit of a sleep-in, a beach morning or a leisurely brunch somewhere lovely? Ask our Tour Leaders for their recommendations. This afternoon you will be picked up for our half day Favela Tour. Meet the welcoming locals of this pacified Favela and discover the origins of Rio’s legendary Samba Schools during this excellent 3-hour tour. Our experienced local guide will take you to the top of the Favela, where you’ll get breathtaking views and see Rio from a completely different perspective. On the walk back down through the narrow streets, you truly get a unique insight into the vibrant spirit of the proud inhabitants. At the end, you'll have the opportunity to buy yourself a delicious icy açai from the local sellers – which will be sure to replenish your energy for the afternoon and night ahead! Tonight is the last night of our Carnival package! We have a big finale night planned. Starting with a delicious Brazilian Churrasco BBQ dinner (return to the buffet/BBQ as many times as you wish). You will be accompanied to this restaurant by our Tour Leader and then given the option to party on with all of our crew for the final night of Rio Carnival – One last Party! - We’ll be sure to go out with a bang!

Rio de Janeiro, Brazil: Tuesday (4 March): Accommodation Check-Out (B) This great adventure comes to an end today. The rest of the day is yours, just remember the check-out is at 11AM (or sometimes MIDDAY – you’ll be advised!). We wish you safe travels for your onward journey! *Airport Drop-Off: Please note, an optional transfer to the airport can be scheduled for an additional cost. NOTE: Please note the itinerary is subject to change due to unexpected circumstances such as bad weather, changes to Carnival schedules, traffic, diversions, demonstrations/strikes, inconveniences or changes caused by local operators and authorities and other circumstances beyond our control.

tourName: Rio, Iguazu & Pantanal group tour, Brazil
placesVisited: City tour of Rio de Janeiro including Sugar Loaf and Corcovado, Iguazu Falls, City tour of Brasilia, Campo Grande, Explore the Pantanal staying in a traditional lodge
generalInfo:
Brazil is the most biodiverse country in the world, with the Amazon rainforest, wildlife-rich wetlands, tropical coastline and epic waterfalls. It is also one of the largest countries in the world, so it can be challenging to cover much terrain on a short holiday. This 12-day Rio to Iguazu Falls holiday makes use of internal flights, private transport and a particularly well planned itinerary to ensure you see as much as possible, without feeling rushed.

Get underway in sunny, cosmopolitan Rio de Janeiro, where a highlight will be the rack-and-pinion railway up through Tijuca National Park, the largest urban forest in the world, to the summit of Corcovado Mountain where the iconic Christ the Redeemer statue awaits. From Rio you fly to another Brazilian icon, the spectacular Iguazu Falls where you’ll spend two days exploring the forested region around the waterfalls.

With a brief pause in the capital, Brasilia, with its futuristic and innovative architecture, you’ll fly on to Campo Grande, gateway to the Pantanal wetlands. In this vast wilderness of rivers, marsh, savannah and cattle ranches, much of it flooded during the rainy season, you’ll stay in a traditional pousada (lodge). From there, expert local guides lead you out to track wildlife including giant anteaters, caimans, capybaras and, perhaps, even jaguars. You’ll head out on foot, by boat and by 4WD, with the option to ride on horseback, too

This small group tour has a maximum of 16 people, minimising your impact on the fragile environments and remote communities you will visit. You’ll travel the entire way with a brilliant tour leader, and, as is fitting given Brazil’s renowned biodiversity, you will stay in accommodation with strong environmental credentials. That includes a family-run lodge in the Pantanal that is involved with efforts to conserve the endemic blue macaw.

dayInfo.title: Arrive in Rio
dayInfo.description: Those of you arriving on an international flight will be met at the airport by the tour leader or a local representative and escorted to the group hotel in Copacabana. The drive from here into the city gives a fleeting glimpse of the docks and commercial centre as you head towards the magnificent stretch of sand at Copacabana beach. You spend 2 days in Rio, with time to explore this extraordinary city of extremes. Sumptuous apartments overlook the sparkling bays against a backdrop of half-built shanty towns, favelas, which cling precariously to the hillsides. Rio squats among towering jungle-clad granite mountains, fringed with white sand beaches which swoop down into the Atlantic surf.

dayInfo.title: City tour of Rio including Sugar Loaf and Corcovado mountain.
dayInfo.description: Today is an included tour of this iconic city, including the cable car up to Sugar Loaf mountain, a twin-peaked vertical mountain protruding over the ocean, and enjoy the views back over the city and into the lush mountains beyond. You’ll also board a steep rack-and-pinion railway which glides up through tropical Tijuca National Park, the largest urban forest in the world dripping with fruit and flowers, to reach the summit of Corcovado Mountain. Here the famous 40m art deco Christ the Redeemer statue soars above the city, arms outspread benevolently. On a clear day the views over the city and out across the ocean and outlying islands are stupendous.

dayInfo.title: Fly to the Iguazú Falls. Visit both the Brazilian and the Argentine sides.
dayInfo.description: We head to the airport for the flight to the Iguazú Falls. Situated where the borders of Argentina, Brazil and Paraguay converge, the town of Foz do Iguaçu is your base for 2 days. A total of 275 falls thunder through dense forest over a 2.5km stretch. The u-shaped Devil’s Throat is a thunderous gorge where the frothy water of the Iguazú River crashes over a 1km wide precipice and columns of vapour are thrown skyward. Elsewhere the river flows decorously through the rainforest breaking up into dozens of smaller falls. You can often spot colourful toucans perched in the foliage above the tumultuous waters. From the Brazilian side there is a broad panorama of these magnificent falls, while a series of walkways on the Argentine side take you through the abundant forest, beneath and even behind some of the dramatic cataracts. Walking within touching distance of these thunderous cascades, your clothes and hair soaked with the spray, is one of the most invigorating experiences to be had.

dayInfo.title: Fly to the capital Brasilia.
dayInfo.description: Fly to Brasília which was inaugurated in 1960 as Brazil’s new capital, designed by Lúcio Costa and Oscar Niemeyer to symbolize national progress. Its layout, resembling an airplane, and its modernist architecture make it one of the most innovative cities in the world.

dayInfo.title: Tour of the nation's capital
dayInfo.description: Spend the day exploring Brasília’s main attractions: Our Lady of Fatima Church, the Super Blocks district, St John Bosco Sanctuary, the Metropolitan Cathedral, JK Memorial, Itamaraty Palace, Ministries Boulevard, Three Powers Square, Jabarú and Alvorada Palaces, and the South Embassies Sector.

dayInfo.title: Fly to Campo Grande and drive to the Pantanal wildlife wetlands. Excursions by boat and on foot, based at a traditional pousada (lodge).
dayInfo.description: In the west of Brazil lies a vast area of wetlands known as the Pantanal, a flight to Campo Grande followed by a few hours by road take you into this vast wilderness. This huge territory of rivers, marsh, savannah and cattle ranches is considered to have the world’s most dense flora and fauna ecosystem, and in the wet season 80% of the land is submerged by the overflowing rivers which nurture a rich variety of aquatic plants. You are based in a lodge which is also, a working ranch. Take a 4WD by road and track tour through the open grasslands, stunted cerrado vegetation, swampland and permanently flooded bays. Ride a horse across the savannah, motorboat down the local rivers or paddle a canoe on one of the numerous waterways. Set out to explore the countryside at night, when the Pantanal comes alive with the sounds of frogs and insects. Over 3 full days knowledgeable local guides take you to areas inhabited by giant storks, caiman, giant anteaters, armadillos, howler monkeys and capybara. There is also an extraordinary variety of birdlife: in addition to the aquatic birds egrets, macaws, parakeets and toucans all provide clusters of colour in the low trees. Whatever the season, the wildlife is abundant.

dayInfo.title: Return to Rio.
dayInfo.description: Fly back to Rio for a final night in one of the world’s most exciting cities.

dayInfo.title: Depart for international flight or extension.

tourName: Rio, Iguazu & Salvador holiday in Brazil
generalInfo:
Brazil: A Land of Wonders and Warmth
Brazil, the largest country in Latin America, welcomes you with its vibrant culture, golden beaches, and awe-inspiring natural landscapes. From the joyful Carnival in Rio and the stunning Christ the Redeemer to the wild Amazon Rainforest and the dramatic Iguaçu Falls, every destination is a new adventure.

Explore the charming colonial towns of Ouro Preto, Paraty, and Salvador, where history and culture shine through cobbled streets and Afro-Brazilian traditions. Discover the unique landscapes of Lençóis Maranhenses, feel the coastal charm of Búzios, and be amazed by the wetlands of the Pantanal.

In Brazil, every moment is alive with color, rhythm, and heartfelt hospitality—an invitation to experience the soul of South America.

dayInfo.description: Leisure Time in Rio de Janeiro: Discovering the City Beyond the Ordinary Your first day in Brazil invites you to uncover the hidden gems of Rio de Janeiro. Enjoy the serenity of Leme Beach, with stunning views of Sugarloaf Mountain—an escape from the buzz of Copacabana and Ipanema. Dive into culture at the Museum of Tomorrow, the MAR, or the intimate Eva Klabin Museum. In the evening, embrace the rhythm of the city with samba or forró dance classes in lively Lapa. A perfect introduction to the vibrant soul of Brazil.

Full-Day City Tour in Rio de Janeiro: Icons, Culture & Flavors Discover the essence of Rio on a full-day tour through its most iconic landmarks. Ride the train through the lush Tijuca Forest to reach the majestic Christ the Redeemer, and take the cable car to Sugarloaf Mountain for stunning views of Guanabara Bay. Enjoy panoramic stops at the vibrant Sambadrome and the legendary Maracanã Stadium. Midday, savor local flavors with a traditional lunch in a Carioca restaurant. The tour ends with a return to your hotel—your heart full of culture, color, and unforgettable moments.

Discover Tijuca Forest: Caves, Waterfalls & Wildlife Explore the natural wonders of Tijuca Forest, one of the largest urban forests in the world. Visit the breathtaking Mirante da China and the impressive Taunay Waterfall, the highest in the park. Then, follow easy trails leading to hidden caves and refreshing waterfalls—perfect for all levels, especially on sunny days. Along the way, spot local wildlife such as marmosets, capuchin monkeys, toucans, and colorful birds. Learn how this forest was reforested in the 19th century by Emperor Pedro II to protect Rio’s water sources—an inspiring blend of nature, history, and sustainability.

Free Time in Foz do Iguaçu: A Visit to the Bird Park If your arrival allows, take advantage of your free time to explore the Bird Park—an important sanctuary for the conservation of Atlantic Forest species. Home to over 1,300 birds from 143 species, including toucans, macaws, and flamingos, the park offers an up-close experience with many rescued and endangered animals. Walk along lush trails, learn about wildlife protection efforts, and enjoy meaningful contact with nature in one of Brazil’s most inspiring eco-tourism spots.

Excursion to the Iguaçu Falls – Brazilian Side Embark on an unforgettable journey to witness the splendor of Iguaçu Falls from the Brazilian side.
