dayInfo.description: Brazil’s Bahia capital of Salvador is a fascinating city with a sparkling coastline and vibrant Afro-Brazilian culture that you will immerse yourself in shortly after your transfer here from Foz do Iguaçu. You will check into your accommodation and join a guide who will show you around town and introduce you to the welcoming local lifestyle, point your attention to the Portuguese colonial architecture, and bring you to the azure waters of the Peninsula of Itapagipe. You may tuck into fresh seafood dishes before you head for the Church of Bonfim, the Monserrat district, and the Mercado Modelo.

dayInfo.title: Salvador - Visit the São Joaquim Market and More
dayInfo.description: The local markets of Salvador are the best places to discover more about Brazil’s Bahia culture as they offer a chance to explore the cuisine, chat with locals, and browse handmade curiosities. You will peruse the centuries-old São Joaquim market and wander down lanes lined with baskets full of fruits and vegetables, sizzling grills that serve traditional delicacies, and spice shelves that paint the market in red and orange colors. After lunch, you will continue along cobblestone sidewalks to the Church of San Francisco, the Cathedral, and the Municipal Square before dinner at a famous acarajés Baianos restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Itacaré - Settle Into Your Accommodation on Cocoa Coast
dayInfo.description: You will transfer to the airport after breakfast and leave the bustling Bahia neighborhoods for the breathtaking tropical beaches of Itacaré. Your guide will collect you at Ilhéus and take you to the seaside resort town where you will check into a glamorous accommodation that overlooks the mouth of the Rio de Contas on Brazil’s Cocoa Coast. Your accommodation is fitted with a lavish spa and therapy center where you may sit back and unwind while you relish unique treatments such as Watsu, Shirodhara, a purification bath, or an Ibeji bath.

dayInfo.title: Itacaré - Wander the Fazenda Juerana Forest
dayInfo.description: Views from your accommodation overlook the shimmering sapphire Cocoa Coast and they will be a brilliant backdrop for a morning coffee and breakfast. Afterward, you will head a little inland to explore the immaculate landscapes of the Fazenda Juerana forest. Flowers blossom along the pathways that wind through the canopy, birds soar above the trees, and other creatures scuttle amongst the flourishing greenery en route to the Cachoeira waterfall where you may stop to catch your breath. You may swim in the warm tropical waters and capture gorgeous photography before you return to the beach for surfing or yoga.

dayInfo.title: Itacaré - Tour the Serra de Conduru State Park
dayInfo.description: The Serra de Conduru State Park is a lush wildlife sanctuary that wraps the Cocoa Coast of Bahia, Brazil, and invites visitors to explore the diversity and majesty of the surrounding wilderness. You will do so from the Floresta Viva Institute where you will meet an informative guide with a deep understanding of the natural habitats, flora, and fauna. You will learn about the local conservation efforts and greater Brazilian environmental protection initiatives as you tour the Serra de Conduru State Park and photograph magnificent wildlife and scenery along the way.

dayInfo.title: Ilheus - Goodbye, Brazil
dayInfo.description: You will wake up to the sounds of nature and step out onto your balcony to embrace the sunrise over the sea as you sip on a cup of coffee and think back on your exquisite adventure of classic Brazil. Today, you will pack your bags and transfer to the Ilheus airport for your flight home. The journey will give you a few more opportunities to view the magnificent Brazilian landscape before you say your farewells, check-in for your flight, and board the plane.

tourName: Cosmopolitan Brazil: 12-Day Art and History Discovery Tour
placesVisited: Brasilia and the West, Rio de Janeiro, Paraty, Sao Paulo
generalInfo: Embrace adventure in cosmopolitan cities and charm on colonial lanes as you explore history and modernity on your cultural 12-day Brazil trip. Discover the bright lights of the exotic night and the soothing sounds of lapping waters, the enticing rhythm of the cities and the contrasting crash of hidden waterfalls as you experience legends brought to life around the iconic cities of Brasilia, Rio de Janeiro, Paraty, and Sao Paulo.

dayInfo.title: Brasilia - Arrive in Brazil’s Modern Capital City
dayInfo.description: Brasilia is the embodiment of design and cosmopolitan culture in Brazil where the avant garde meets purpose and function strategy meets beauty. The city resembles a vision for the future, where architecture creates intrinsic beauty accentuated by the food and neighborhoods with distinctive personalities. Your flight will land at Presidente Juscelino Kubitschek International Airport, where your private transfer will greet you upon arrival. After settling into the beauty of your accommodation, the remainder of the day is yours to embrace the heritage UNESCO site and its examples of modern planning or to enjoy culinary culture at a celebrated cafe.

dayInfo.title: Brasilia - Discover the Beauty of Brasilia
dayInfo.description: Your guide will lead you on an exceptional journey through the city’s architectural majesty to introduce you to monuments like Praca dos Tres Poderes, the governmental square that turns buildings into modern art. As the focal point of design, the collection of monuments and federal buildings include sculptures and the magnificent Pavilhao Nacional flagpole. At the Juscelino Kubitschek Bridge, you can revel in the distinguished crisscrossing arches that tower over the reflective lake. At night, the floodlights accentuate the soaring curves of the architecture and glint against the body of water below.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janeiro - Travel to Colorful and Lively Rio
dayInfo.description: Rio de Janeiro can often embody the spirit of Brazil simply with its setting nestled between the mountains and the sea. The remarkable setting surroundings support one of the world’s biggest cities to combine stunning natural and cultural landscapes. As your flight descends into the city, you may see renowned Sugarloaf Mountain soaring above the harbor and long crescent beaches that capture the city’s tropical image for visitors. You can spend the day as you please, perhaps visiting the famous golden sands of Copacabana Beach where visitors play soccer, sip caipirinhas, or let the warm water lap at their feet.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janeiro - Tour and Embrace Rio’s Charms
dayInfo.description: Your guide for the day will introduce you to the marvels of Rio beginning at Christ the Redeemer, one of the Seven Modern Wonders of the World. The Art Deco statue crowns Corcovado summit and has become the symbol of the city. The train will offer a scenic ride through the lush Tijuca Forest before you reach the base of the towering figure. You can indulge in some of the city’s best views as you ascend to Pao de Acucar by cable car. The city unfolds beneath you from Christ the Redeemer in the west to Copacabana Beach in the south.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janeiro - Traverse Rio’s Famous Lifestyle
dayInfo.description: Your guide will lead you on an immersive walking tour of the historical and commercial downtown in the morning. The Royal Chapel dates back to the 19th century and retains its Baroque facade anda stone carving etched with gold and white. The open-air mall of the Saara neighborhood is the largest of its kind in the city with 11 streets hosting 88 stores. Contemporary ambiance meets the preserved architecture with vendors displaying clothing and toys. In the evening, you may wish to visit a local restaurant to experience the traditional samba and lively atmosphere of Rio after dark.

dayInfo.title: Paraty - Travel to Coastal Colonial Paraty
dayInfo.description: You will fly to the combination of coastal beauty and jungle ambiance at Paraty. Your guide will lead through the colonial center and pedestrianized streets at your pace. The white buildings with multi-colored borders and latticed windows will contrast the surrounding lush jungle yet accent the enveloping natural beauty. Islands will rise out of the bay while the cobblestone streets add to local charm. At Forte Defensor Perpetuo, you can enjoy sweeping views of the coastline from atop the walls of the antique defenses built to protect the transiting gold from pirates.

dayInfo.title: Paraty - Follow the Gold Road to the Rainforest
dayInfo.description: You will follow the Gold Road for the day to walk in the footsteps of tumultuous histories as your guide leads you back in time on a trail built by African slaves in the 18th century. The winding walkway takes you through the rainforest and beneath the dense canopy. You may hear the crash of waterfalls and take a break to dip your feet into refreshing pools and watch as vines drip down from the trees to absorb the moisture. When you reach a local distillery, you can learn about crafting delicious traditional cachaca, a Brazilian spirit made from fermented sugarcane.

dayInfo.title: Paraty - Enjoy the Local Beaches and Islands
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will board a boat and set out onto the crystalline turquoise waters to explore the golden beaches and remote islands decorating the bay. The boat may weigh anchor where you can dive into the warm Atlantic Ocean in search of curious fish and vibrant coral. Starfish may cling to rocks near preserved underwater forests. On land, you can lounge on the soft golden sands and relax to the sound of the lapping waves against the secluded shoreline. You may also experience rolling hillsides covered in jungle and glinting turquoise waters that embody a tropical paradise.

dayInfo.title: Sao Paulo - Venture to Exciting Sao Paulo
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you may wish to stroll through the colonial streets of Paraty once more or spend the morning at the beach before your flight to Sao Paolo. The city unfolds as a paradise for the cosmopolitan, with art-house cinemas and gourmet restaurants, chic bistros and captivating museums. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to experience the pace of one of South America’s largest cities. You could spend time wandering the immense greenery of Ibirapuera Park to find a blend of monuments, museums, gardens, trails, and lakes that create paradise in the bustling metropolis.

dayInfo.title: Sao Paulo - Revel in Global Diversity in One City
dayInfo.description: Your guide will take you on a tour to demonstrate the sheer proportion of Sao Paolo as you collect the vibrant culture and stunning diversity that has attracted visitors from around the world. The foundations of Sao Bento church date back to the 16th century and hosts a neo-Gothic facade and elaborate stained glass while the Vila Madalena neighborhood embodies the rhythmic nightlife and historic bohemian culture of the city’s lifestyle and art. Alleyways covered in graffiti act as a symbol of artistic integrity while restaurants fill the streets with aromas of traditional and contemporary recipes.

dayInfo.title: Sao Paulo - Uncover Brazil’s Innovated Trends
dayInfo.description: You will once more step into the streets of Sao Paolo with your guide to find the evolution of artistic vision in the architectural icons that decorate the distinctive neighborhoods. At Sao Francisco Church, you can find remnants of the 17th and 18th centuries in the classic Baroque aesthetic. In the Praça do Patriarca district, you can wander the main square that acts as a gateway to some of the city’s most important monuments including the Art Museum of Sao Paulo where passersby can interact with important art and the Lausanne building that combines Brazilian Brutalims with contemporary style.

dayInfo.title: Sao Paulo - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: After breakfast you may choose to visit Faro Santander to enjoy the view from atop Brazil’s iconic skyscraper or spend time wandering through the neoclassical museum of Pina_Luz to view spectacular Brazilian art including the works of Pualistas, descendents of the first Portuguese colonists and indigenous peoples. When you are ready, your private transfer will meet you at the hotel lobby and escort you to Governor Andre Franco Montoro International Airport for your flight home.

tourName: History, Gastronomy and Modern Art of Brazil: Minas Gerais for 8 Days
placesVisited: Belo Horizonte, Ouro Preto, Congonhas, Tiradentes, Ibitipoca
generalInfo: Explore the modern cityscapes that boast captivating contemporary museums and art, colonial communities that share authentic Mineiran cuisine, and lush forest reserves that present the breathtaking wilderness on your 8-day Brazil tour with excursions to Minas Gerais. Uncover the cultural treasures of Belo Horizonte, Ouro Preto, Congonhas, and Tiradentes en route to the illustrious natural paradise of Ibitipoca as you indulge natural wonder and tropical charm.

dayInfo.title: Belo Horizonte - Make Way for Minas Gerais
dayInfo.description: The capital city of Brazil’s Minas Gerais state, Belo Horizonte, will invite you to discover scintillating South America and its magnificent mix of cultural influences, culinary highlights, and art. You will transfer from the airport to your accommodation and then to the city center where your architectural tour of the surrounding buildings, museums, and neighborhoods will begin. The colorful murals of Igreja Sao Francisco De Assis and regal 1920s design of Centro Cultural Banco do Brasil will impress on your exploration of the city’s charming districts. Later, you will transfer to a chic restaurant with views of the olive-green mountains.

dayInfo.title: Belo Horizonte - Brazilian Breakfasts and the Inhotim Museum
dayInfo.description: Breakfast in Belo Horizonte typically consists of continental snacks, although, you are encouraged to explore the traditional Minas Gerais breakfast flavors. A mouth-watering cheese ball known as pão de queijo is typically enjoyed with a cup of strong coffee and local Canastra cheese can be plated as part of Quitandas Mineiras , a spread of Brazilian pastries, condiments, and cheeses. After breakfast, you will visit the iconic Inhotim Museum. The modern open-air museum is the largest in Latin America and welcomes thousands to view its rare collection of plants in the Botanical Garden and exquisite contemporary exhibits peppering the park.

dayInfo.title: Tiradentes - Cultural Tour of Three Colonial Cities
dayInfo.description: You will wake up and pack your things this morning in anticipation of the adventures of Minas Gerais ahead. Your guide will greet you at your accommodation and invite you to tour three colonial cities whose skylines paint the evergreen mountains that rise and fall across the Minas Gerais state. Baroque architecture lines narrow cobblestone streets in Ouro Preto, the Sanctuary of Bom Jesus de Matosinhos in Congonhas houses the soapstone Twelve Prophets of Aleijadinho, and the architecture, gastronomy, and atmosphere of Tiradentes retain the city’s 18th-century colonial charm. You will spend the following few nights in this historic destination.

dayInfo.title: Tiradentes - Culinary Exploration of Minas Gerais Cuisine
dayInfo.description: You will yearn to explore Tiradentes, the gastronomic capital of Minas Gerais, this morning. Regional flavors will present themselves to you on a culinary tour from your accommodation to exquisite eateries that riddle the city’s neighborhoods. First on the menu will be an authentic family-run restaurant that specializes in brilliant Brazilian breakfasts. Next up, you will visit gourmet establishments that highlight the modern renditions of classic Minas Gerais colonial cuisine before you visit a culinary school to master making the delicacies yourself. You may also join cheese-makers to indulge in the local produce and learn about the region’s culinary history.

dayInfo.title: Ibitipoca - Escape to the Brazilian Forest
dayInfo.description: You may wake up early and rush to the streets of Tiradentes to peruse boutiques and stalls for commemorative trinkets and colorful garments unique to the Minas Gerais region. You will continue through the mountains after purchasing a selection of memorabilia on a transfer bound for the breathtaking forests of Ibitipoca. You will step back in time as you arrive at your accommodation in the forest reserve that boasts a century-old history and sits harmoniously against the flourishing greenery. The animals and birdlife will call to you to explore the reserve before dinner on a quiet night beneath the stars.

dayInfo.title: Ibitipoca - Wade in the Monkey’s Waterfall
dayInfo.description: There is little time to waste in Ibitipoca as there is so much to see and do, although, your adventures will be peaceful amongst the thriving wilderness that teems with indigenous animals, birds, and plants. After breakfast, your guide will help you navigate the thick bush and lead you through the towering canopy to the Cachoeira dos Macacos , or Monkey’s Waterfall. The sheet of water flows over mossy rocks between the trees and falls into a small natural pool that glimmers orange as the sunlight reflects off of the hazel ravine floor. You can embrace an afternoon in the water.

dayInfo.title: Ibitipoca - Snapshot the Window of the Sky
dayInfo.description: Today, you will capture one of the most iconic pictures in Ibitipoca after a short but stunning hike through the lush forest. You will cross bridges and climb slopes to reach Janela do Céu , the Window of the Sky. This particular spot sits at the summit of a towering waterfall where the gentle stream flows through thick greenery and tall trees that create an arch over the river. You may sit at the edge of the falls as your guide takes photographs behind you that look out beyond the river and trees to the mountains rising in the distance.

dayInfo.title: Ibitipoca - One Last Brazilian Bite to Eat
dayInfo.description: Your final morning in Brazil will feature a soundtrack of the singing birds and the occasional how of Muriqui monkeys. You may sip a cup of coffee as you watch the sunrise over Ibitipoca and envelope the sprawling greenery in golden light. The smell of breakfast will begin to emanate from the kitchen and invite you to tuck into your last Brazilian meal before you pack up your belongings. After breakfast, you will meet your transfer and head for the airport to catch your plane to Rio de Janeiro and beyond.

tourName: Marvels of Peru and Brazil Tour: Natural and Cultural Discoveries
placesVisited: Lima, Sacred Valley, Machu Picchu, Puno, Iguazu, Rio de Janeiro
generalInfo: South America reliably presents visitors wit a unique cocktail of raw natural beauty and charming urban centers, and this 15-day tour of Brazil and Peru will present plenty of both as you make your way from the rugged Andean mountains to the shores of the Atlantic ocean. A combination of leisure time and guided excursions will also ensure that you make the most out of each destination you visit.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Bustling Metropolis of Peru
dayInfo.description: Tucked along the westernmost edge of South America, Peru reliably seduces even the most reluctant visitor with breathtaking scenery, stunning wildlife, and warm hospitality. All this will be your to enjoy as your embark on your inaugural day on this South American tour. There is perhaps no better ambassador of this vibrant country than its capital of Lima, where after your arrival, a comfortable transfer will whisk you effortlessly from the outskirts into the heart of this bustling metropolis. After you have settled into your lush hotel, you will have the remainder of the day to explore.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Roll Up Your Sleeves on a Cooking Course
dayInfo.description: Natives of South America first discovered the region's agricultural potential and settled here well before the Europeans arrived in the 16th-century. Eventually, Lima would grow to become the country's most populous city, and today will be your playground for an immersion into the city's world-renowned gastronomic reputation. After a leisurely morning, you will embark on a food tour of the city where Peru's abundant flavors and ingredients will be yours to enjoy including more types of potato than you may have thought possible. Later, an instructor will lead you through a cooking course before you enjoy the remainder of the afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Taking a Turn for the Spontaneous on a Leisure Day
dayInfo.description: As the morning light first casts Lima's skyscrapers and lofty bluffs in a soft glow, you will have the chance to rise with the sun or hit the snooze button for a few final moments of restful slumber. No matter how you decide to start the day, the central theme today is leisure, as you can explore this exotic corner of South America at your own pace. Perhaps you want to descend the steep bluffs for a surfing course in the refreshing waters or amble along the colorful neighborhoods of Miraflores before concluding your day at a delicious restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Ancient Capital of the Inca
dayInfo.description: Today you will turn your back on the hustle and bustle of Lima and make your way in the direction of those ancient ruins and sacred valleys of the impressive civilization that once inhabited the lofty peaks of the Andes. Prior to the arrival of the Europeans, the Inca were the largest civilization in South America and they have left clues of their greatness all over the landscape of Peru. After a leisurely morning in Lima, you will plunge into the heart of this empire with a tour of the ancient capital of Cusco.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Strolling Through the Inca Ruins
dayInfo.description: Today Cusco is an international destination and gateway to the nearby UNESCO-listed ruins of Macchu Picchu and rare is the season that tourists are absent from this great city. Thus the mornings are an excellent time to stroll the cobbled lanes and rustic neighborhoods of the Andean city to enjoy Cusco's quieter side. After a delicious breakfast this morning, you will make your way to Machu Picchu aboard the train that runs along the scenic Sacred Valley where you can enjoy a stunning a guided tour up the mountainous slopes and through the stoney ruins before returning to your comfortable accommodations.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Ambling Through This UNESCO World Heritage Site
dayInfo.description: In 1983, Cusco earned the title of a UNESCO World Heritage site and it will take you little time to see why as this jewel of the Andes allures you with it's fabulous Inca ruins, colonial architecture, open squares, and friendly locals. Today you will be able to step into the history and rich culture found here in abundance on a leisurely walking tour of the city center where a knowledgeable guide will introduce you to the Temple of the Sun, the Sacsayhuaman fortress, and a host of other unforgettable sights.

dayInfo.title: Puno – An Andean Train Ride
dayInfo.description: As far a mountain ranges go, the Andes are not to be trifled with and the elevation itself may leave you breathless even if the amazing sights of Peru do not. Today you will continue your tour of this lofty and legendary setting as you turn your back on the rugged charm of Cusco and your gateway to Machu Picchu to head further south to the world's highest navigable lake. This transfer will be made by rail and you can enjoy a spectacular and comfortable train ride through the Andes before arriving at the lakeside community of Puno.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Returning to the Pacific
dayInfo.description: According to Inca tradition, Lake Titicaca is imbued with many strong spirits and is considered a sacred space. As you awake to your first morning in Puno, the day will be yours to explore on an unforgettable tour of the lake, the islands of Taquile and Uros, and the colorful communities that dot the shoreline. As you rock to the rhythm of the waves on your cruise, a knowledgeable local guide will regale you with the tales and legends that abound here, and in the evening you will depart and make your way back to Lima.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu – Chasing Waterfalls in Brazil
dayInfo.description: Your transnational tour will continue as you turn your back on the seaside beauty of Lima and make your way into the heart of the South American continent in search of the region's breathtaking waterfalls. Technically, Brazil is your destination today however after your transfer arrives at Iguazu, you will see that this famous park and attraction sits at the juncture of Paraguay, Brazil, and Argentina. After your flight lands, a comfortable transfer will convey you to your conveniently located hotel where you will have the remainder of the day to explore this vibrant setting.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu – Exploring A Rainforest Paradise
dayInfo.description: Subtropical rainforest, roaring waterfalls, and spectacular views will all greet you on your first morning at Iguazu, and after enjoying a delicious breakfast from your accommodating hotel, you will be able to plunge into this UNESCO World Heritage site on a guided walking tour of the falls and national park. Feel free to unleash your curiosity on your knowledgeable guide who will happily answer your questions before leaving you to spend the remainder of the afternoon at leisure either relaxing in the comfort of your lush hotel and exploring the adjacent neighborhoods of this vibrant community.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu – Journey to the Foot of the Falls
dayInfo.description: Today you will be able to enjoy an entirely different view of the falls as you awake to your final morning in Iguazu. By now, you will have undoubtedly grown accustomed to the sound of rushing water and after a relaxing morning, today you will be able to make your way to the Argentinian side of the falls where a short train ride will convey you to the trailhead of a short and scenic walk along the viewing platforms of the national park. In the afternoon, you will embark on a riverboat cruise that will take you to the very foot of the falls.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janiero – A Return to the Sea
dayInfo.description: Today you will depart on the landlocked beauty of Iguazu National Park and make your way back to the ocean, but this time it is the tranquil shores of the Atlantic rather than Pacific you'll be enjoying. After a leisurely morning, you will enjoy a final breakfast from your charming hotel staff before boarding your domestic flight to Rio de Janeiro. Upon arrival to Brazil's second largest city, you will make your way to the hotel where you can spend the remainder of the day basking in the relaxing atmosphere.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janeiro – Taking a Turn for the Panoramic
dayInfo.description: Everything looks different from 2,300 ft above sea level, and today you will be able to see a side of Rio missed by those who never leave the beaches. After a relaxing morning, you will embark on an epic journey towards that massive statue of Christ dominating the landscape on the nearby hill for a tour of this award-winning attraction. In the afternoon, you can make your way to the adjacent Sugar Loaf Mountains for an entirely different perspective of the sprawling city. By the tour's end, you will have enjoyed a bird's eye view of the city and surrounding coastal beauty.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janeiro – Soaking Up the Seaside Atmosphere
dayInfo.description: No trip to Rio de Janeiro is complete without enjoying an abundance of leisure time to explore the city at your own pace, and today you will be able to enjoy just that, as you chart your own course through the palaces, parks, and plazas of this stunning city. Or perhaps you want to take a turn for the relaxing. Rio presents visitors with an abundance of beaches and waterfronts to survey Brazil's vibrant beach life and that hardest part will be choosing which pristine beach to visit.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janeiro – Departing Brazil's Warm Hospitality
dayInfo.description: As the morning sun slowly casts its golden hue over the mountain top statue of Christ the Redeemer, dawn in Rio will present you with one final opportunity to explore the quiet streets, colorful neighborhoods, and urban charm of Rio before departing. From Peru and the Pacific Ocean to Brazil and the Atlantic, this two-week tour has offered you some of the unbridled adventures that await visitors to South America. After a delicious breakfast from your doting hotel staff, a transfer will arrive to ensure your timely arrival at the nearby airport for your return flight home.

tourName: Ultimate Honeymoon in Brazil: City Charm and Exotic Islands
placesVisited: Rio de Janeiro, Paraty, Olinda, Recife, Fernando de Noronha
generalInfo: Create a treasured experience with a romantic escape into luxury, coastal ambiance, artisan beauty, and historic charm during your 13-day couple’s Brazil tour. Explore exotic islands around Paraty. Embrace the vibrant atmosphere of Rio. Indulge in the colonial lanes of Olinda. Find beachside bliss in Fernando de Noronha. During your unforgettable getaway to Brazil, you can customize every day to your preferences to discover local beauty and embrace true passion.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janeiro - Arrive in Romantic Rio
dayInfo.description: The combination of natural beauty and urban ambiance makes Rio de Janeiro one of the most compelling cities in the world. With soaring mountains, a long crescent of beaches, and a generous collection of open spaces and parks, you can easily feel enchanted upon your arrival. Your private transfer will greet you at the airport and escort you to the comforts of your accommodation where you will have the remainder of the day at your leisure to dig your toes into Copacabana Beach or indulge in a sunset cruise across Baia de Guanabara to embrace Rio’s romance.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janeiro - Discover Rio’s Famous Beauty
dayInfo.description: The majestic ambiance of the city will envelop you as your guide leads you to the most romantic and beautiful corners of the city. You may start by taking the train through the lush Tijuca Forest to reach the base of Christ the Redeemer, the renowned statue that crowns the summit of Mount Corcovado. You can take the cable railway to reach the top of Sugarloaf Mountain to enjoy the ambiance as the breadth of the city unfolds below. Enjoy the remarkable panorama that sweeps across the bay to reveal lush greenery, undulating mountains, and the sprawling colors of the metropolis.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janeiro - Enjoy a Tasty Walking Tour of Rio
dayInfo.description: You can indulge in the daily life of locals with a guided tour of the historical city center. As you uncover remnants of colonial architecture, you may spot the Museu Historico Nacional inside a building from the 18th century. The impressive collection displays relics of the country’s founding to imperial coaches and massive oil paintings. In the Saara neighborhood, you can experience the spirit of the marketplace where locals flock to the main avenues lined with merchants and fill the cariocas looking for the best deal. You may stop at a historical restaurant to sample Rio’s traditional flavors.

dayInfo.title: Paraty - Travel to Colonial History and Charm
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can spend time walking along the esplanade of Ipanema where sidewalk cafes and restaurants line the walkway before your private transfer escorts you to the airport for your flight to Paraty. The charming town was once a thriving gold port and now acts as a refuge to artists who find inspiration among the juxtaposition of colonial architecture and edging emerald hills and bay speckled with islands. You can find the timeless ambiance romantic as your guide leads you on a tour of the Historical Center where whitewashed facades and brightly colored trim line the cobblestone streets.

dayInfo.title: Paraty - Wander the Remains of the Gold Road
dayInfo.description: You will venture into the wilderness outside of the cityscape for a tour of the Gold Road that connects Minas Gerais with Paraty. The trail will take you back in time as seen through the remaining paving stones and those usurped by the grass and vines. You may hear the sounds of wildlife hidden in the trees as you travel down the road before reaching a natural waterfall. The secluded cascade will provide a soothing change from the trail as you listen to the rush of water and dip your toes into the pool before you reach a cachaca distillery.

dayInfo.title: Paraty - Embrace the Islands and Waters of Paraty
dayInfo.description: Today you can embrace passion and beauty on a sailing tour around the Bay of Paraty. The scent of sea air may mix with the aroma of fringing tropical trees before you weigh anchor to reach secluded island shores the fade into the clear turquoise waters. The boat may stop at locations for you to dive into the calm Atlantic and snorkel in search of colorful marine life. As you explore the islands, you may find pristine beaches with warm, welcoming waters removed from any crowds to provide you with the perfect setting for a charming picnic.

dayInfo.title: Olinda - Uncover the Beauty and Wonder of Recife
dayInfo.description: You will travel to Recife to uncover the beauty of the largest cultural and leisure center for the Northeast captured in a collection of rivers, bridges, and the mixture of modern and antique architecture filtered through the lens of tropical beauty. You can follow your guide along the esplanades of panoramic urban beaches where elegant buildings overlooking the turquoise waters and the aromas of coconuts and briny air lead to hidden sea pools. At the Old Fortress, you can find the five-pointed defenses now protecting old maps and historic photos as the City Museum before you continue onward to Olinda.

dayInfo.title: Olinda - Explore Antique and Artistic Olinda
dayInfo.description: You can quickly settle into the charming atmosphere of Olinda, one of Brazil’s oldest cities. Irregular stones pave the street beneath the bright facades of the lining houses. Lush palm trees rise between the architecture and interrupt the connection between the clear ocean blue and bright blue sky. Embrace the artistic lifestyle found in the artisan shops and the stunning panoramas that lead to the public square of Largo da Misericordia. Art is a way of life in town as you may find contemporary exhibits or traveling puppet exhibitions set against the backdrop of the tranquil horizon.

dayInfo.title: Fernando de Noronha - Bask in the Atlantic Emerald
dayInfo.description: You will travel with your private driver to Fernando de Noronha in the morning to find the stunning archipelago where you can bask in the jewel of the Atlantic. The natural beauty combines tropical seclusion with pristine coastline. At the first beach you visit, you can relax on the fine sands, enjoy the crystal-clear waters, watch the rolling waves, and indulge in the view of the twin rock islands rising out of the ocean. The natural towers embody the feeling of your surroundings as you embrace the remote ambiance, the captivating contrasts, and the welcoming beauty of the coastline.

dayInfo.title: Fernando de Noronha - Wander Trails and Coastline
dayInfo.description: You will get up early before the tropical warmth fills the day to find the scenic views around Fernando de Noronha. You can visit the belvedere of the dolphins for a panorama over the water where you may see rotifer and spinner dolphins leaping out of the water and rotating while in the air. The spirit of passion will guide you along the trails winding across the gorgeous coastline before you reach the renowned viewpoint of Dois Irmaos to find the golden sand, lapping waters, turquoise sea, and isolated islands contrasting the horizon.

dayInfo.title: Fernando de Noronha - Indulge in a Boat Tour
dayInfo.description: Venture out to the remote islands across Fernando de Noronha on a guided boat tour. You can relax on the beaches or leap into the water at your pace as you indulge in the quiet charms of untouched nature. You may visit Sancho Beach, an award-winning section of coastline where the clear water leads to a protected marine park that supports turtles, dolphins, and hundreds of different fish species. At Sapata Point, you can enjoy the view over the rock formations spanning the waters of Dolphins’ Bay before the boat weighs anchor so you can swim in the warm water.

dayInfo.title: Fernando de Noronha - Revel in a Day at Leisure
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to explore and enjoy Fernando de Noronha at your own pace from walking the historical trail around the main island or snorkeling in the inviting waters. For a relaxing way to enjoy the waters, you can take a kayak excursion to enjoy the unspoiled tropical landscape. You can paddle along sheltered coasts and stop at the beaches of your choosing to revel in the soft sands and listen to the way the water ebbs and flows against the shoreline. At sunset, you can share a drink and watch as the colors layer the horizon.

dayInfo.title: Fernando de Noronha - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you may find the aromas of coffee and coconut at breakfast. You can once more indulge in the ambiance of the day and your setting with a walk on the beach or a visit to the Shark Museum to learn more about the fascinating world of marine life or simply for the views of the water. Your private transfer will meet you when you are ready and escort you to the airport to being your journey home to bring an end to your romantic escapade in Brazil.

tourName: Wonders of Buenos Aires, Patagonia and Iguazu Falls Tour
placesVisited: Buenos Aires, Trelew, Puerto Madryn, Valdes Peninsula, Punta Tombo, Ushuaia, Tierra del Fuego National Park, El Calafate, Los Glaciares National Park, Iguazú Falls
generalInfo: The natural splendor of Argentina is captivating, deriving from bright blue glaciers, dramatic waterfalls, and inspiring wildlife. Penguins waddle along sandy beaches next to the rippling current of the Atlantic Ocean. An unbelievable ice field spans mountain ranges and compresses the shores of Argentina’s largest lake. Flamingos bask on the banks of a quiet lagoon. The Iguazu River shifts from tranquil waters to thundering cascades at Iguazu Falls. Your Buenos Aires, Patagonia and Iguazu Falls Tour is handmade to show you the best of Argentina’s eclectic beauty, from rolling snowcapped mountaintops to emerald tropical jungles.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - The Thrill of Buenos Aires
dayInfo.description: Buenos Aires is a city of movement. The history of tango enlivens the streets with dancers performing out in the open air. Spanish colonial buildings continue to decorate neighborhoods. Cafes set out tables on sidewalks and allow guests to sip their wine as they watch the city pass them by. The aroma of chocolate drifts out of the charming chocolatiers and blends into the scent of browning filo dough from the bakeries. Your flight lands at Ministro Pistarini International Airport. Your private transfer greets you upon your arrival and escorts you into the heart of the city. You settle into your lavish accommodation located in the enchanting neighborhood of Recoleta. The barrio boasts fine architecture and a lush environment. The neoclassical Libreria el Ateneo Grand Splendid is a remarkable bookstore in Recoleta. The building was designed in the 19th century and acted as a theater in the early 20th century with the ability to hold more than 1,000 occupants. It stands in the main gallery today, showcasing the vast display of books encircling the main floor and the upper tiers of the former theater. Frescoes adorn the central dome, adding to the classical ambiance of the unique bookstore.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Life and Times of Buenos Aires
dayInfo.description: In the morning, locals stroll along the greenery of Plaza Francia. Palm trees tower over the tranquil grass. The square is close to the famous Recoleta Cemetery. On weekends, an artisan market fills the plaza to great local fanfare, showcasing handcrafted leather goods, jewelry, and the aroma of freshly pressed Argentinian coffee. After breakfast, your guide meets you at the hotel. You are eager to set out on a tour of the city and explore the grandeur of Buenos Aires, which was once called, the “Paris of South America.” Each barrio in Buenos Aires has a distinctive character. With 47 neighborhoods in total, the charms of the city are endless. Your guide leads you along the marvelous pedestrian street of Avenida de Mayo. The boulevard runs through the center of the city’s historic center near the presidential mansion of Casa Rosada. The Building Inmobiliaria is unmistakable with its two red domes and Italian neoclassical façade. The neo-Gothic building of Palacio Barolo lines the same street in dramatic fashion. Domes, columns, vaults and bronzes create an amalgamation of historic designs with expressive attention to detail to shape the images of Dante Alighieri’s Divine Comedy . The connection to the Italian masterwork is notable in the way the palace grounds are divided to ensure divine numerology.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Madryn - Gateway to the Peninsula
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the sunlight washes over the quiet wide avenues of Recoleta. Oak trees cast comfortable shade over the sidewalks. Cafes open their doors and set out tables alongside the street for locals to linger in the comforts of fresh espresso and delectable medialunas , a pastry similar to a croissant. After breakfast, your private transfer meets you at the hotel lobby and escorts you to the airport for your flight to Puerto Madryn. The city has a small town atmosphere. Locals invite newcomers with warm smiles and an eagerness to show the delicate, friendly nature of the seaside streets. Fishing boats wade in the marina in the afternoon after a long morning scouring the Valdes Peninsula. Welsh settlers founded the town in the late 19th century. A pathway along the beach provides stunning views to the azure waters breaking against the shores of the city.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Madryn - Splendors of the Peninsula
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can hear the water of Atlantic Ocean brushing against the shores of the Valdes Peninsula. Statues of immigrants and the Tehuelche people decorate the walkways on the shoreline, paying homage to the history of Puerto Madryn. After breakfast, your guide meets you at the hotel. The sea breeze drifts along the city streets, carrying the pleasant salty-sweet aroma of the ocean. Today takes you on the Valdes Peninsula to witness the natural wonders of the coastline. You cross a narrow strip of land bordered by the lapping waters of the Atlantic. When you reach Caleta Valdes, your guide points out the creek in the distance. The water glows indigo against the still shores. Between the months of August and November, sea elephants travel through the small inlet, following the tide, in search of shelter on the quiet shores of the bay. The sea elephants lounge on the shores over the mixture of sand and pebbles. Males average a length of 16 feet and can weigh up to more than 6,600 pounds. During mating season, the males call out to females, making an extraordinary noise that reverberates over the lulling waves. In the distance at Puerto Piramides, golden cliffs rise over the crescent shape of the bay.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Madryn - Penguins of the South
dayInfo.description: The sweet aroma of the sea continues to encompass the seaside city. At breakfast, the scent of Argentine coffee accompanies the flakey, buttery texture of medialunas . Your guide meets you at the hotel after your meal. You travel along the coastline to the edges of Punta Tombo. In the warm and longer days of spring, Magellan Penguins travel up the coastline and settle on the beach of Punta Tombo, ranging from September to mid-March. The fauna reservation was created in the 1970s with the intention of protecting the diverse fauna of Argentina and the breeding grounds of the Magellan Penguins. A clear pathway winds around the brush-clad dunes. You can hear the loud squawk of the penguins over the crashing waves. The paths lead over the dunes to the beach, where you find penguin families lounging in the sun, waddling against the current, and diving into the water. They can swim up to nearly five miles per hour, using their fins like wings to gain momentum. They kick their feet as rudders. When they emerge from the water, their black and white feathers glisten in the sunlight.

dayInfo.title: Ushuaia - Penguin Colonies to the Edge of the World
dayInfo.description: Between the months of May to December, whales travel along the coats of Patagonia. The Goliaths of the sea can sometimes be seen on the shores of the city, lifting their magnificent tails from the water and splashing back down. After breakfast, your private transfer meets you at the hotel and escorts you to El Tehuelche Airport for your flight to Ushuaia. The city is known as the “End of the World,” for its location as the southernmost city in South America and across the globe. The cobalt waters of the Beagle Channel brush the edges of the cityscape. Snowcapped Andean peaks descend into the channel, marking the end of the longest mountain range in the world. Les Eclaireurs Lighthouse stands 33 feet tall and flashes a light every ten seconds with a range of over eight miles. Fishing trawlers cruise the channel in the morning, returning from a daily search for the perfect catch. Sea lions lounge on nearby islands. The dramatic scenery accentuates Ushuaia’s location.

dayInfo.title: Tierra del Fuego - In the Land of Fire
dayInfo.description: Tierra del Fuego means “Land of Fire,” and was named by Spanish sailors after witnessing the various campfires of the local Yamana people on the shore. Today, Tierra del Fuego National Park protects the unique biosphere of the flora, fauna, and waterways at the southern edge of the continent. After breakfast, your guide leads you from the hotel into the stunning grounds of the national park. Glaciers crown craggy mountains. Waterfalls hide behind the lush forest. Shrubs encircle crystal clear glacial lakes. Bright wildflowers bloom across vast meadows. Windswept cliffs tower over the Strait of Magellan on the Chilean side of the national park. Your guide leads you to Lapataia Bay. The reflective surface of the water captures the tranquil but powerful landscape. In the background, granite peaks climb into the sky. Ducks and geese glide past on the water, causing ripples. Lush greenery encircles the bay, blanketing the nearby hills.

dayInfo.title: Tierra del Fuego - Cruising the Beagle
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of yerba mate accompanies breakfast. The tea is the preferred beverage of Argentines, who enjoy the herbaceous aroma and bitter flavor. After breakfast, you make your way to the marina, where you board a boat ready to take on the Beagle Channel. The strait separates Isla Grande of Tierra del Fuego from the numerous other islands connected to the national park. The Beagle Channel stretches 150 miles long and is nearly three miles wide at its narrowest point. The water is calm near Ushuaia. You look back at the city for a remarkable panorama of the Andean peaks dwarfing the cityscape. The mountains in the background add to the water in the foreground for an unparalleled framing of Ushuaia. On Bridges Island, verdant moss blankets boulders. Windswept grasses rise and fall with the rolling hills. The island offers dramatic contrast to the city. The uninhabited landscape opens to a view of the rugged mountaintops in the distance. Large shells inadvertently decorate the shoreline of the island. When you return to Ushuaia, your private transfer takes you to Ushuaia-Malvinas Argentinas International Airport for your flight to El Calafate.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Glorious Glacier
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of chocolate emanates from the numerous chocolatiers on the main street of Libertador in the alpine town of El Calafate. At breakfast, you sip a rejuvenating cup of fresh espresso to start the day. Your guide meets you at the hotel and leads you on one of many Patagonia tours to the wondrous grounds of Los Glaciares National Park, home to the Perito Moreno glacier. The national park was established in the 1930s and encompasses more than 2,800 square miles. Lake Argentino, the largest freshwater lake in the country, borders the edges of the Perito Moreno Glacier. The ice forms a narrow channel that raises the water level. After you explore the walkways overlooking the glacier, you step onto a viewing boat that takes you along the strait, known as “Iceberg Channel.” The water is crystal clear. The breeze is crisp on your skin. The boat ventures close to the ice cliff of the glacier, which rises an average of 240 feet above the water. Bright blue and white color radiates from the ice. The boat keeps a safe distance from the edge of the ice field, which is one of the few glaciers in Patagonia that is expanding. Icebergs float in the water, evidence of past pieces of the glacier breaking away from the ice field and splashing into the canal.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Quiet Majesty of El Calafate
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can see flamingoes grazing in the water on the shores of Lago Argentino. The lake brushes against the southern edges of El Calafate. The aroma of chocolate blends with the scent of pine encircling the city. The alpine ambiance emanates from the stone buildings along Libertador, adorned with wooden doorframes. The day is yours to indulge in the beauty surrounding El Calafate, from sailing on the turquoise glacial waters of Lake Argentino to exploring the handcrafted goods displayed in the city. For a distinctive view of life and culture in Patagonia, you could venture to an Estancia , a ranch that exemplifies the frontier lifestyle of cowboys and ranchers. Vast plains extend to the foothills. Rivers wind along the rolling steppe. Sheep graze on the soft grass. It feels as though you have traveled back in time to an antique version of Argentina. You can saddle up on a horse and follow your guide to the Trocoman River. Trout swim in the water and feed on the reeds. The romantic image of cowboy life becomes clear. The sky is open, the landscape is pristine, and the combination offers a tranquil escape. At lunch, an enticing aroma drifts from the ranch house. All the Gauchos enjoy the home-cooked flavors of a parrilla , an Argentinian barbecue.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Energetic Return
dayInfo.description: The calm waters of the Lago Argentino shimmer turquoise in the morning light. The scent of chocolate travels along the main street of the city once more, emanating from elaborate window displays. After breakfast, your private transfer takes you to Comandante Armando Tola International Airport for your flight to Buenos Aires. The city retains its endless, alluring energy. Underneath the historic neighborhood of San Telmo is a vast network of subterranean tunnels constructed in the 16th century. Buenos Aires is filled with elaborate secrets and vibrant history. The day is yours to relax at a charming café, stroll along the opulent shopping street of Avenida Florida, or visit the unique museum of Centro Cultural Borges. The entrance to the tunnels is located on the property of El Zanjon, a historic mansion. The neighborhood of San Telmo was once home to the wealthiest porteños , locals of Buenos Aires. A tour of the property takes you to the foundations of the antique mansion, from the water wells to the upper floors; you can even explore underground to the restored tunnels once used by the founders of the city. Exposed brickwork lines the passageways. The aroma of aged earth emanates from the walls. The experience is unique and unforgettable.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu Falls - The Banks of the Cliffs
dayInfo.description: In the morning, artists set out their canvases on the streets of La Boca, a vibrant barrio filled with brightly painted corrugated homes and tango dancers performing on the street. Artists capture the brilliance of their neighborhood in motion, painting the movement of the dancers, the succulent cuisine created by the cafes, and the inspired faces of passersby. After breakfast, your private transfer escorts you to the airport for your flight north to Iguazu. The city of Puerto Iguazu sits on the border of Paraguay and Brazil. The tropical atmosphere serves as a contrast to the alpine ambiance of Patagonia. Palm trees and verdant brush rustle in the refreshing breeze. An incredible jungle landscape encircles the city. At Güirá Oga, also known as the birdhouse, the native birds of the jungle are given a second chance after having been rescued. The center is located in a protected area that encompasses nearly 47 acres of land. Toucans perch on high branches. Eagles open their wings to absorb the sunlight. Even mammals roam through the landscape, such as anteaters and monkeys. Your private transfer escorts you to your lavish accommodation on the outskirts of Iguazu National Park, where you can spend your time relaxing in the tropical environment.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu Falls - Bright Side of Argentina
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can hear toucans calling out in the jungle canopy. Their bright beaks stand out from the lush foliage. After your meal, your guide escorts you from the hotel into the gates of Iguazu National Park. The Argentine side of the park contains trails winding around 81 square miles of verdant trees and splendid riverbanks. You can hear the thundering waters of Iguazu Falls echoing along the pathways. A collection of more than 270 falls tumble over the crescent-shaped cliffs and islets. The paths take you across the bridges and underneath the dangling trees, which open up to multiple views of the staggering waterfalls overtaking the landscape. On the lower footpath, you come to an outlook taking in a smaller waterfall. Refracted light in a powerful water stream bursts into a rainbow. Mist sporadically rises out of the confluence of the waterfall and the riverbed encompassing the viewpoint. Monkeys linger near snack areas in search of discarded food. Both the upper and lower paths provide opportunities to take in the unparalleled natural splendor of Iguazu. When you reach the canyon known as Devil’s Throat, the cascade descends more than 262 feet into the tumult of the whitewater below, encased in the crescent of cliffs.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu Falls - Colorful Side of Brazil
dayInfo.description: The grandeur of Iguazu Falls continues today with a visit to the Brazilian side of Iguazu National Park. After breakfast, your private transfer and guide lead you over the border into Brazil and the gates of the national park. The park in Argentina offered a series of walkways to explore. The park in Brazil offers an unforgettable panorama of the falls. Iguazu Falls divides the Iguazu River into the upper and lower levels, forming a natural boundary between Argentina and Brazil. The wooden bridge carries you over the water to the edge of the cliff. The series of 275 individual waterfalls become clear. Some waterfalls pour over the edges of the upper cliffs with powerful waves. Smaller falls trickle down the precipice with strings of water. The uproarious sound is that of endless rumbling. At the heart of Devil’s Throat, you can see a cloud of mist rising above the upper levels of the river. There is no better way to take in the panoramic view of Iguazu Falls. Verdant tropical trees rise out of the sporadic outcroppings dividing the falls. The air is warm, but the breeze carries refreshing condensation.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu Falls - Into the Air
dayInfo.description: In the morning, scarlet macaws groom venture into the canopy in search of breakfast. Their bright red plumage glows in the sunlight, piercing through the treetops. Their tail feathers can grow more than 15 inches long. The feather trails behind them when they fly, drifting like a gliding ribbon. At breakfast, you can sip on a refreshing cup of coffee and take in the tropical sights and sounds of Puerto Iguazu once more. Soon your private transfer will meet you in the hotel lobby, ready to escort you to Cataratas del Iguazu International Airport for your flight home. You have seen expanding glaciers and tropical waterfalls during your time in Argentina. The majesty can always continue by extending your time in South America with a visit to Brazil or Peru.

tourName: Wonders of South America: Chile, Argentina, Uruguay and Brazil Tour
placesVisited: Santiago, Puerto Varas, Bariloche, Buenos Aires, Colonia del Sacramento, Montevideo, Iguazú Falls
generalInfo: Urbane sophistication and the grandness of nature, the epicurean pleasures of a fine glass of wine and the cultural delights of a tango show, the Great Outdoors and the Marvels of Civilization; all of this and more can be found in stupendous South America. From the Andres to the Atlantic, from the Plaza de Armas to the Plaza de Mayo, this is a journey that will stir your imagination and leave you begging for more.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Arrival in South America
dayInfo.description: Touch down on the outskirts of scintillating Santiago, nestled between the calm blue waters of the Pacific, the teeth-like protrusions of the Andes, and filled with culture and history unlike any other Latin American capital. A private driver will be awaiting your arrival and will transport you to your elegant and perfectly located hotel, where you can rest and recover from your long journey before spending the afternoon exploring. Your expertly guided tour of Santiago begins at the gorgeous Moneda Palace, a neoclassical marvel that is one of the only buildings of its kind on the continent. Turn next to the Plaza de Armas, the heart and soul of Santiago, surrounded by the venerable and august Metropolitan Cathedral, the stately Central Post Office Building, and the colonial Palacio de la Real Audiencia de Santiago. Then make your way to the Parque Forestal, a gorgeous urban park that is home to two of Chile’s greatest art museums, before making the climb up San Cristobal Hill to gain an inspiring panorama of the city below and the ocean beyond. You’ll also tour two of Santiago’s quaintest neighborhoods, the artsy and endearing barrio of Bellavista and the handicraft village of Los Graneros del Alba.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Exploring Sensational Santiago
dayInfo.description: Today, head further afield to discover Chile’s other urban wonders, or make for the valleys of Chile’s burgeoning wine industry to try some of the tastiest exports of this captivating country. Those interested in urban grandeur would do well to head northwest to the port city of Valparaiso, a simply breathtaking metropolis that is hailed as “The Jewel of the Pacific.” You’ll find the oldest stock exchange in Latin America here and Chile’s first public library, as well as stunning edifices like the Chilean Naval Office and the Valparaiso Customs House. Nearby is the charming village of Vina del Mar, where you’ll be entranced by the scene on the beach and delighted by the Flower Clock and Wulff Castle, both local landmarks that have become major tourist attractions. Oenophiles will want to make their way inland, to the fecund valleys that have quickly become one of the world’s best up-and-coming wine producers. Blessed with an impeccable natural climate – it combines the best of the wine regions of California and France – and an impressive population of innovative wine makers. Chilean wineries like Cousino Macul and Concha y Toro have firmly established these New World vintners as among the world’s best. You’ll learn all about the history and science behind growing grapes in Chile, get a lovely tour of the sleek and alluring facilities and, of course, a taste of the fruits of their labor. The evening sees you back in Santiago, where you might want to check out the city’s excellent jazz scene: the Club de Jazz de Santiago is arguably the city’s best, and attracts the finest jazz talent from around the world.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Varas – The Wonders of Chile
dayInfo.description: Head to the airport to board a plane that will take you south to the reaches of Patagonia, the rugged portion of country that earned its name when Magellan thought the natives were a race of giants. You alight at Puerto Montt, whose horizon is dominated by the picturesque peak of the Osorno Volcano, and whose stateliness echoes Mount Fuji in Japan. You’ll get a chance to walk along the pristine Pelluco Beach and marvel at Chinquihue on the azure blue waters of the Tenglo Canal before visiting the scenic town of Angelmo, a darling fishing port known throughout the country for its fine wool goods and elegant woodworking. Continue on to Puerto Varas, a picturesque German town nestled on the shores of Llanquihue Lake, and climb the gentle slope of Philippi Hill to gain an incredible vista over this simply spectacular landscape. The seemingly endless blue stretch of the lake gives way to the prominent visage of Osorno, and the Germanic-style buildings like Puerto Varas Church offer a charming addition to this natural wonderland. The evening sees you in your hotel in Puerto Varas.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche – Crossing into Argentina
dayInfo.description: You’ll leave Chile and enter Argentina in inimitable fashion as you wind your way through Chile’s Lake District, traveling by land and by water as you cross the borderlands. A bus will take you to the town of Petrohue, where you’ll hop on board a catamaran that will take you across the glass-smooth waters of Lake Todos Los Santos before alighting in Puella. A rustic and traditional lunch will fill you up and prepare you for the rest of your journey. Be sure to have your camera ready because you’ll want to record some of the amazing sights of this expedition. A car will take you past the border crossing into Argentina, concluding at Puerto Frias, where a boat will bring you across one of Argentina’s sensational lakes to the village of Puerto Alegre. A bus ride will take you through the west of Argentina until Puerto Blest, where you’ll board another boat that will take you across Lake Nahuel Huapi, arguably the most picturesque stretch of water in this peerless region. You disembark at Puerto Panuelo, where a car will be waiting to transfer you to Bariloche.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche – The Many Charms of Beautiful Bariloche
dayInfo.description: You’ll have today to discover the secrets of Bariloche, renowned for its Swiss-like atmosphere and the panoply of outdoor activities. Take a serene and leisurely cruise on Lake Nahuel Huapi, explore the matchless beauty of Nahuel Huapi National Park, or ride the historic steam train that will take you up into the Argentine plateaus, much as visitors have done since the early 20th century. Those looking for more rigorous activities would do well to hire a knowledgeable guide to lead you through this awe-inspiring country or take you to glaciers and marvelous panoramas of Cerro Tronador. Nature lovers will definitely want to make a detour to the unique Bosque de Arrayanes , where orange trees bathe the region in gorgeous color and capture the imagination with their indescribable beauty and incredible rareness; an island of Japan is the only other place where you’ll find a similar grove on Earth. You can also engage in more unconventional outdoor activities, from horseback riding to paragliding, before the afternoon sees you boarding a flight to Buenos Aires, the irresistible capital of Argentina.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Discovering the Paris of Latin America
dayInfo.description: Buenos Aires is a city unlike any other, with a European ambiance and a flair that is all South America. You’ll get a great first look at this majestic metropolis on a fully guided tour, led by an informative and friendly guide who will show you all the highlights. Begin at the noteworthy Plaza de Mayo, a center for Argentine activism since 1810, where you’ll find the iconic Casa Rosada, the “Pink House,” that serves as the executive mansion of the President of Argentina. Then stop by the posh and elegant district of San Telmo, the oldest barrio (neighborhood) in Buenos Aires, where the colonial feel lingers in the air and the cobblestone streets impart a cozy feel. Then turn to the bright and boisterous neighborhood of La Boca, where the vibrant Caminito (street museum and a traditional alley) echoes the verve and vitality of this Italian immigrant community. This is one of the birthplaces of the tango and the home to Boca Juniors, one of the most successful soccer teams in the history of Argentina. Continue on to the stately and sedate neighborhoods of Palermo and La Recoleta, where Argentina’s elite live, work and play, before visiting the newly improved dockyards at Puerto Madero. The architecture here is varied and innovative, and it is the perfect place to get a sense of the newest trends in Buenos Aires life. This evening is spent in spectacular fashion as you attend one of the city’s famous tango shows, where the best dancers, singers and musicians in the world will entertain you in true Argentine fashion while you enjoy a delicious meal, complete with sumptuous wine and decadent desserts. If you would like to learn more about Zicasso’s custom trips to Buenos Aires and Argentina, visit the Argentina tours section.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires ��– The Mystique and Romance of Argentine Cowboys
dayInfo.description: Head out to the wide pampas (plains), where cattle have been herded for generations by the dramatic gauchos . You’ll get a first-hand glimpse of the impressive riding skills of these amazing individuals, learn all about their culture, history and traditions, and even enjoy a delicious lunch cooked outdoors over an open fire, in much the same way that food has been served for centuries on these rolling plains. It is a voyage that you will recount to your friends for years, regaling them with the sights, sounds and smells of this stupendous region, where the very soul of Argentina seems to spring to life. The afternoon sees you back in Buenos Aires, where you can relax in your hotel before setting out for a world-class dinner. The beef here is justifiably renowned for its high quality, but there are also a number of excellent eateries dedicated to cuisines from across the globe, from Italian fare to Pan-Asian cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Colonia del Sacramento – A Luxurious Getaway on the Shores of the Rio de la Plata
dayInfo.description: Cross the wide Rio de la Plata from Argentina into tiny Uruguay, a model democracy in a continent full of dictatorships and a small, yet proud, nation wedged between the two giants of South America. You disembark in Uruguay’s oldest city, the enchanting town of Colonia del Sacramento, whose allegiances have changed hands nearly a dozen times as the Spanish fought the Portuguese and the Brazilians fought the Argentinians for this strategic river post. The historic city center was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1995 and is filled with romantic reminders of the city’s vibrant past, from the City Gate to the Parque de Ferrando, to the former bullring at the Real de San Carlos. Ramble down the Rambla Costanera, one of the finest streets in the city, before shopping at the Feria de la Ciudad, one of the best-loved local markets in all of Uruguay. You spend the evening at one of Colonia’s finest hotels, where you’re sure to feel all the magic of this august and venerable city.

dayInfo.title: Montevideo – Encountering Uruguay
dayInfo.description: Spend another day enjoying all the highlights of mesmerizing Colonia del Sacramento, seeing the sights you might have missed the day before. Make your way to the tree lined Plaza Mayor to see some of the city’s favorite attractions and finest museums. Visit the Convent of San Francisco dating from the 17th century, the magnificent Basilica of the Holy Sacrament, and the fascinating Portuguese Museum, filled with examples of Portuguese jewelry, furniture, military uniforms, and even maps of some of the greatest Portuguese naval expeditions. In the afternoon, you’ll be transferred to Montevideo, the capital of Uruguay and the political, cultural, and social heart of the country. Drop your bags off at the hotel, and then hit one of the city’s excellent parillas , (grills) where the meat is sure to rival even the best offerings from their more famous southern neighbor.

dayInfo.title: Montevideo – An Introduction to Magnificent Montevideo
dayInfo.description: Montevideo is a city dedicated to the reminders of Uruguay’s greatest political heroes, and your guided tour will show off all of the memorials and monuments of this often overlooked world capital. Start at the elegant Ciudad Vieja, the oldest part of Montevideo, located on a small peninsula that juts prominently out into the waters of the Rio de la Plata. You’ll walk around the perimeter of Plaza Constitucion, where you’ll find many of the cities oldest and most important buildings, like the former Cabildo that now houses an impressive museum, and the opulent Montevideo Metropolitan Cathedral. Cross through the Gateway of the Citadel – the last remaining remnant of the once mighty fortress that dominated the Ciudad Vieja – before entering Plaza Independencia, where you’ll encounter many of the government buildings where Uruguay’s daily business is run. You’ll also see the striking and baroque towers of the Salvo Palace and the iconic Teatro Solis, the national theater of Uruguay and one of the best-known performance venues in Latin America. Head for the Prado, one of Uruguay’s prettiest neighborhoods and the site of its largest public park, and take in the astounding juxtaposition of botanical gardens and fine architecture on your way. Finish off in high style as you drive by some of the most expensive homes and exclusive neighborhoods in the city. The evening sees you back at your hotel.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu Falls – Turning to a Natural Wonder
dayInfo.description: Leave Montevideo and fly to Puerto Iguazu, the Argentine city that is located near the matchless Iguazu Falls National Park, home to the eponymous Iguazu Falls, one of the largest and most spectacular collections of cataracts on the planet. After arriving at the visitor center in the heart of the park, you’ll board a train that will take you to a series of well maintained and easy to navigate paths that run throughout the park, getting you up close and personal with this powerful natural phenomenon. The highlight of the park is the Devil’s Throat, a half-mile long precipice where nearly half of all the water flow is diverted; it is truly a sight not to be missed, and it certainly puts Niagara Falls to shame. The late afternoon sees you at your hotel on the Brazilian side of the falls, and in the evening you’ll enjoy a scrumptious dinner among your entrancing surroundings.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – The Glories of Nature, the Grandeur of Civilization
dayInfo.description: This morning, you’ll receive an expertly guided tour of the Brazilian side of Iguazu Falls . You might find the waterworks less remarkable from this vantage point, but the fecund plant life and exciting fauna is sure to make up for it. Make your way through the diverse and spellbinding forests that surround the falls, learning about the many species of wildlife that call this area home, as well as the amazing biodiversity that makes this area one of the greatest natural areas on the continent. The afternoon sees you back at Puerto Iguazu, ready to board the plane that will return you to Buenos Aires for one final night in Latin America. Enjoy the hustle and bustle of bountiful Buenos Aires, and reminisce about all of the incredible experiences you’ve enjoyed over the past twelve days.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Returning Home
dayInfo.description: This morning, enjoy one last breath of Latin America before a private driver takes you from your hotel to the airport in Buenos Aires. You’ll be sure to spend most of the plane ride home remembering the best moments from your South American adventure, and trying to plan your return visit to this unforgettable continent.
